title: Java Developer [F/M/X]
description:
Job description
  
  

You will be part of the One Engine Software download team and we are perhaps working with the most exciting digital product right now, i.e. enabling upgrade of cars over the air, cable and Wi-Fi Anywhere. Anytime.
  
Today there are one team working in the product, situated in Gothenburg. We believe in the power of WE and co-creation and do most of our work in our Torslanda team place but there is also a possibility to balance on-site work with work from home.
  
It is not a coincidence that we say Volvo For Life. We make sure we have a warm and inclusive team culture mixed with personal development and many of us stay in the company for a long time either taking on larger responsibility in a product or expand into the ART or elsewhere in the company.
  
  

What you’ll do
  
In the OE team you will be part of an agile environment where you as a developer are empowered to bring requirements all the way from the reviewing stage to production ready functionality, while also working with code reviews and setting up plans for how to architect our code to have top notch quality and allow for quick changes.
  
  

Do You Fit the Profile? We believe that you are proficient in both backend and frontend development, with a primary focus on Java. You enjoy solving complex technical problems and know how to build scalable and high-performing solutions. Your experience includes working with databases such as MongoDB and Cosmos DB, and you are familiar with CI/CD pipelines. You are also skilled in Kubernetes, TypeScript, Azure Cloud Services, and Angular. Understanding agile team principles is essential.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Expertise in Java (primary focus).
  
Experience with backend and frontend development.
  
Knowledge of databases like MongoDB and Cosmos DB.
  
Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines.
  
Proficiency in Kubernetes, TypeScript, Azure Cloud Services, and Angular.
  
Solid understanding of UX/UI principles.
  
Agile team experience and familiarity with agile principles.
  
Ability to manage requirements from the review stage to production-ready functionality.
  
  

**Preferred/Bonus Skills:**  

Knowledge of .Net/C#.
  
Experience in direct client management.
  
Network programming (e.g., TCP/UDP, vehicle protocols like CAN, CAN-FD, DoIP, UDS).
  
Windows desktop application development (WinUI/WPF).
  
DevOps scenarios in business-critical consumer environments.
  
Passion for user needs and user journey.
  
Strong understanding of scalable and well-performing solution development.
  
Experience in automotive software and over-the-air updates.
  
  

**Who You Are:** You are a curious and open-minded individual who continuously strives to develop your skillsets. You are willing to develop a T-shaped profile by expanding your knowledge into one or more other specializations. You are self-motivated and capable of networking with stakeholders for technical elicitation. You will stand out if you have experience in DevOps scenarios in a business-critical consumer environment.
  
  

Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.
  
  

Who are we?
  
Amaris Consulting is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7500 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.
  
  

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
  
  

**Brief Call:** Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
  
  

Interviews (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
  
  

**Case study:** Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
  
  

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
  
We look forward to meeting you!

title: Python Developer Data [F/M/X]
description:
Job description
  
  

**Position Overview:** We are seeking a highly skilled Embedded Software Test Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our embedded software products. You will work closely with software developers, testers, and architects to develop and maintain automated test scripts, conduct performance measurements, and identify and resolve performance issues.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Develop and maintain automated test scripts for embedded software.
  
Conduct real-time performance measurements and evaluate performance trends.
  
Identify and resolve performance issues, including memory leaks and code inefficiencies.
  
Collaborate with software engineers, testers, and architects to optimize software performance.
  
Work within a Continuous Integration (CI) environment.
  
Utilize various testing frameworks and tools to ensure software quality.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Strong competence in Python and similar Object-Oriented programming languages (not only for scripting).
  
Experience working in Unix/Linux environments and shell scripting.
  
Practical experience with software development workflows (GitLab, Gerrit, and Jenkins).
  
Expertise in containerization, Kubernetes, and Portable Batch System (PBS).
  
Experience with system deployment and operations, preferably in an open-source environment.
  
Familiarity with database systems (Relational, SQL, NoSQL) and data engineering tools (Apache Spark, Hadoop).
  
Experience with Airflow is a plus.
  
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
  
Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
  
  

**Preferred Skills:**  

Familiarity with Portable Batch System (PBS) for workload management, particularly in high-performance computing environments.
  
Experience with system deployment and operations, preferably in an open-source environment.
  
Knowledge of database systems (Relational, SQL, NoSQL) and data engineering tools (Apache Spark, Hadoop).
  
Experience with Airflow is a plus.
  
  

**Who You Are:**  

**Problem Solver:** You possess excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail and a proactive approach to identifying and addressing data-related issues.
  
**Team Player:** You have strong interpersonal and communication skills, enabling you to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
  
**Adaptable and Innovative:** Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, you embrace change and are always looking for new ways to enhance data processes and technologies.
  
  

**What We Offer:**  

Opportunity to work with innovative automotive technologies.
  
A collaborative and inclusive work environment.
  
Continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
  
The chance to make a significant impact on the future of automotive technology.
  
  

**Join Us:** If you are passionate about embedded software development and testing, and have the skills and experience to excel in this role, we encourage you to apply. Be part of a team that is driving the future of intelligent automotive solutions.

title: Backend Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**

  

* Work on the transition from a centralized CRM system to a distributed system.
* Contribute to strategic backend development involving API integrations, SQL databases, and system enhancements.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional team members in a supportive and open culture.
* Engage in hands-on development, with opportunities to explore both frontend and backend tasks.

  

**Your Profile (Must-have requirements)**

  

* Experience: 3+ years in backend development, with a focus on .NET technologies and database management.
* Skills: Proficiency in APIs, SQL databases, and a solid understanding of backend architecture. Full-stack experience is a plus.
* Team Player: Ability to work collaboratively and contribute to a positive team dynamic.
* Language: Fluency in Swedish is essential for effective communication and project execution.
* Flexibility: Comfortable switching between tasks in a fast-paced, small-team environment.

  

  

  

**Application deadline:** 29-01-2025  

  

**About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!  


  



**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Azure utvecklare med erfarenhet till AMF
description:
**Har du några års erfarenhet av Azure-utveckling och vill utvecklas i en spännande roll? AMF söker nu en erfaren Azure-utvecklare med intresse för applikations- och plattformsutveckling. Detta är en möjlighet för dig med 2–4 års erfarenhet att ta nästa steg i karriären och bli en nyckelspelare i ett av Sveriges ledande pensionsbolag.**

**Om rollen:**  

Som Azure-utvecklare på AMF blir du en viktig del av teamet som ansvarar för att systemstöd håller hög kvalitet och driftsäkerhet. Du arbetar med utveckling i produktion och test, och dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar:

* Ständiga förbättringar av systemlösningar.
* Utveckling av nya gränssnitt och plattformsfunktioner i Azure.
* Konfigurering och utveckling av stödsystem kring våra systemlösningar.
* Omvärldsbevakning av nya tekniker och tekniska lösningar.
* Samarbete i tvärfunktionella team och deltagande i kompetensgruppen för systemutveckling.

**Vi erbjuder dig:**

* En roll med ansvar för affärskritiska och centrala system.
* Spännande och utmanande utvecklingsuppgifter mellan försäkringssystemen och interna system.
* En kultur som prioriterar lärande, kunskapsdelning och personlig utveckling.
* Ett positivt samarbetsklimat präglat av innovation och nyfikenhet.

**Ditt team och arbetsplats:**  

Du tillhör avdelningen IT-plattform och arbetar i tvärfunktionella team enligt agila metoder (SAFE). AMF:s kontor ligger centralt i Stockholm nära T-centralen.

**Vi söker dig som:**

* Har en akademisk examen eller motsvarande samt 2–4 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling i Azure.
* Har ett stort tekniskt intresse och är nyfiken på att lära dig nya programmeringsspråk.

**Kompetens inom:**

* Microsoft Azure
* Java
* SQL
* XML
* Webservices
* API:er
* GitHub Copilot
* Agila metoder


Meriterande är erfarenhet av IBM integrationsplattform IBM ACE (ESQL och Java).

**Att jobba som Azure-utvecklare på AMF:**  

Hos AMF arbetar du i en stabil organisation med starkt fokus på innovation och kvalitet. Du ingår i ett team där samarbete och utveckling står i centrum. AMF erbjuder en modern arbetsmiljö, balans mellan arbete och fritid samt möjlighet att påverka och växa i din roll.

**Rollen är placerad i Stockholm.**

**Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent:**  

Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att hjälpa techprofessionella att ta nästa steg i karriären. För denna roll blir du anställd av Nexer Tech Talent och arbetar på AMF i Stockholm med start enligt överenskommelse.


Du får tillgång till stöd från en mentor på AMF och en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Vi anordnar regelbundet aktiviteter som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter ett framgångsrikt uppdrag på 12 månader är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos AMF.

**Ansökan**  

Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt. Vid frågor, kontakta Tech Recruiter Olivia Holm på olivia.holm@nexergroup.com.


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

**Om Nexer Group**  

Nexer Tech Talent är en del av Nexer Group – ett techbolag med djupa rötter i svenskt entreprenörskap och innovation. Tillsammans är vi över 2500 medarbetare i 15 länder som i mer än 35 år hjälpt våra kunder att ligga steget före både strategiskt, teknologiskt och kommunikativt. Läs mer om Nexer här.

**Om AMF:**  

AMF är ett av Sveriges ledande pensionsbolag och erbjuder trygga, enkla och prisvärda pensionslösningar. Läs mer om AMF här.

title: Android Developer
description:
Are you an experienced Android developer looking to make a real impact in the green energy transition? Join our team and help develop innovative mobile applications for electric vehicle (EV) charging and payment services. In this role, you will design, develop, and maintain high-quality Android applications that seamlessly integrate with our advanced EV charging infrastructure and payment solutions. Working at the intersection of software and the Internet of Things (IoT), you will collaborate closely with hardware systems such as EV chargers, payment terminals, and access control devices in a dynamic international environment.

**Must Haves:**


Proven experience in Android development using Kotlin and Java


Strong understanding of the Android SDK and Jetpack components


Experience with RESTful APIs and third-party libraries


Familiarity with IoT concepts and hardware integration within mobile applications


Proficiency in version control tools such as Git


Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail


Fluency in Swedish and English


Ability to develop, test, and maintain Android applications for EV charging and payment services


Collaboration with product managers, UX/UI designers, and backend developers to deliver seamless user experiences


Ensure application performance, security, and scalability across different platforms and devices


**Nice to Have:**


Experience in the electric mobility or fintech industries


Knowledge of security protocols and data encryption methods


Familiarity with Agile development methodologies


Experience with CI/CD pipelines for Android applications


Participation in code reviews and contribution to process improvements


Ability to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues


Staying up-to-date with the latest Android development trends and best practices

title: System Developer
description:
We now have a new requirement and are looking for a consultant colleague with the qualifications listed below. The position is part of our consulting business, which means you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments.

*As part of your application, you may be presented to clients/partners as part of the recruitment process. If selected for the assignment, you will be employed by us and work either with clients or on internal projects and assignments as part of our consulting business.*  

  

**Job Description**  

Participate in requirements management, development, building, configuration, and unit testing of various solutions.  

Ensure solutions meet design documentation requirements, undergo peer reviews, and are well-documented.

**Essential requirements:**

  

* A senior, self-driven developer with a strong passion for software development.
* Proven ability to solve complex tasks and take pride in delivering high-quality work.
* Extensive experience in developing solutions using Microsoft Azure, including resources like storage, service bus, web apps, logic apps, and function apps.
* Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 and/or Dynamics 365 Sales is a significant advantage.
* Familiarity with agile principles and experience working in a DevOps team, taking full responsibility for deliveries.
* Can work on site at our Lund office 3 days a week.

**To succeed in this role, you should have:**

* Over 3 years of experience with C#.
* Over 3 years of experience working with Azure resources.
* Experience in CI/CD for Azure components using ARM or Bicep, as well as standard unit test frameworks.
* The ability to translate business requirements into solution design, configuration, and build, as well as determine estimates of effort.
* Experience working in agile environments.
* Knowledge of integration as a concept.

  

**Please explain how you meet all the requirements** **when applying.**  

  

**Last day to apply**: 29-01-2025

 **About Us**  

We currently employ experienced consultants in areas such as System Development, AI, Machine Learning, Testing, Cloud, Infra DevOps, and IT Project Management.  

  

Working at Deploja is something entirely different from working at an ordinary consulting company—and we are really proud of that. So, what makes us unique?  

  

We simply offer more than just a high salary and greater freedom; that’s just the beginning. With us, you’ll find the work environment and opportunities you deserve. Welcome to Deploja, where the grass is indeed greener!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Exciting assignments with our many clients. We focus on long-term projects, which gives you the opportunity to create value for the client while also developing yourself.


A secure monthly salary – together we’ll agree on a base salary depending on your assignments.


Company car – we encourage you to choose an electric car for a more sustainable future.


Occupational pension and great opportunities for salary conversion.


Vacation – Would you like more than 30 days of vacation, perhaps 60 days?


Private health insurance, accident insurance, and life insurance for increased security.


Skills development – you set your own budget and choose the training you wish to attend.


Quality of life – Are you struggling to balance everyday life and wish to work a little less while still earning as much, if not more?

*We handle applications continuously, and due to the high workload, it's especially important to include a short motivation for the position, explaining how you meet the requirements.*

title: Senior .NET Utvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

* Medverka i kravfångst
* Designa, utveckla och implementera mjukvarulösningar


- Utföra enhets- och integrationstester  

* Arbeta med support och felsökning
* Ta fram och underhålla dokumentation

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Minst 8 års arbetslivserfarenhet av system i .NET miljö med mssql databas.
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av webb-baserade lösningar med integrationer till andra system
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av utveckling i Platina
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av GIT
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av C#/.NET Framework under de senaste 10 åren
* Minst 5 års arbetslivserfarenhet av MS SQL Server
* Minst 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Nexus under de senaste 5 åren
* Minst 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Jenkins under de senaste 5 åren
* Minst 4 års arbetslivserfarenhet av agilt systemutvecklingsarbete under de senaste 5 åren
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Entity Framework (5 eller senare)
* Minst 3 års arbetslivserfarenhet av ActiveMQ köhantering
* Minst 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet av Azure Devops under de senaste 2 åren

  

**Meriterande**  

* Erfarenhet av Angular
* Erfarenhet av arbete på större statlig myndighet eller motsvarande
* Praktisk erfarenhet av XML och XSD

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 28-01-2025  

  

**Om Deploja**  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Network Developer to tech company!
description:
**About the Role**  

As a Network Developer you will play a key role at a forward-thinking internet service provider that challenges traditional solutions with innovative network applications and services. The company delivers tailored solutions for both private individuals and businesses and is rapidly expanding in the market. This position offers the opportunity to elevate networking systems with software as the core focus.


As a Network Developer, you will be part of a dynamic team dedicated to creating smarter networks and advanced tools. From day one, you'll dive into tasks like automating service provisioning, enhancing monitoring systems, and developing software components for next-generation network architectures. You will also gain experience with various platforms and engage in both frontend and backend development.

**Your Future Responsibilities**  

In this role you will initially work with:

* Automate service provisioning to streamline operations.
* Enhance monitoring systems to improve performance tracking.
* Develop software for advanced network architectures.
* Collaborate on both frontend and backend development projects.

**We Are Looking for Someone Who:**  

We recognize that you might feel more confident in some areas than others, and that’s why we approach our recruitment process with an open mind. If you’re unsure whether you meet all the requirements, we still encourage you to send in your application—we’d love to hear from you! However, to excel in this role, we believe you should have some experience in the following:

  

* Is a problem-solver with hands-on networking and software development experience.
* Takes initiative and thrives in solving complex challenges.
* Embraces learning new platforms and technologies.
* Ideally you have experience with some of the systems below:
	+ Programming languages: Python, C, Perl, Go, PHP/Vue.js, Bash.
	+ Operating systems: Linux, Cisco IOS, IOS XE, IOS XR, VRP.
	+ Concepts/systems: DHCP, CGNAT, K8s, PowerDNS, BNG, ZTP, Docker, Ansible, Prometheus.

Experience in telecom or similar industries is highly valued.

**Additional Information**

* **Start:** Immediately or with notice, based on your availability.
* **Location:** Stockholm, Malmö or Umeå, with some flexibility.
* **Scope:** Full-time, 40 hours per week.
* **Employment Type:** Permanent.

**About the Client**  

The client is renowned for innovation in networking and software development. They prioritize both technical excellence and personal growth, providing opportunities to expand your skill set and advance within the organization.

**About Wrknest**  

At Wrknest, we dare to think differently. Our approach challenges traditional recruitment methods by focusing on potential over experience alone. Through personalized upskilling, we match talents to the rapidly changing needs of today's digital world. Learn more at www.wrknest.se.

title: Python Developer Data [F/M/X]
description:
**Who are we?**
---------------

**Amaris Consulting** is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.  

  

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
  

  

**Brief Call**: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
  

  

**Interviews** (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
  

  

**Case study**: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
  

  

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
  

We look forward to meeting you!
**Job description**
-------------------

**Position Overview:** We are seeking a highly skilled Embedded Software Test Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our embedded software products. You will work closely with software developers, testers, and architects to develop and maintain automated test scripts, conduct performance measurements, and identify and resolve performance issues.


**Key Responsibilities:**


* Develop and maintain automated test scripts for embedded software.
* Conduct real-time performance measurements and evaluate performance trends.
* Identify and resolve performance issues, including memory leaks and code inefficiencies.
* Collaborate with software engineers, testers, and architects to optimize software performance.
* Work within a Continuous Integration (CI) environment.
* Utilize various testing frameworks and tools to ensure software quality.

  


**Qualifications:**


* Strong competence in Python and similar Object-Oriented programming languages (not only for scripting).
* Experience working in Unix/Linux environments and shell scripting.
* Practical experience with software development workflows (GitLab, Gerrit, and Jenkins).
* Expertise in containerization, Kubernetes, and Portable Batch System (PBS).
* Experience with system deployment and operations, preferably in an open-source environment.
* Familiarity with database systems (Relational, SQL, NoSQL) and data engineering tools (Apache Spark, Hadoop).
* Experience with Airflow is a plus.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience.


**Preferred Skills:**


* Familiarity with Portable Batch System (PBS) for workload management, particularly in high-performance computing environments.
* Experience with system deployment and operations, preferably in an open-source environment.
* Knowledge of database systems (Relational, SQL, NoSQL) and data engineering tools (Apache Spark, Hadoop).
* Experience with Airflow is a plus.


**Who You Are:**


* Problem Solver: You possess excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail and a proactive approach to identifying and addressing data-related issues.
* Team Player: You have strong interpersonal and communication skills, enabling you to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
* Adaptable and Innovative: Comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, you embrace change and are always looking for new ways to enhance data processes and technologies.

  


**What We Offer:**


* Opportunity to work with innovative automotive technologies.
* A collaborative and inclusive work environment.
* Continuous learning and professional development opportunities.
* The chance to make a significant impact on the future of automotive technology.


**Join Us:** If you are passionate about embedded software development and testing, and have the skills and experience to excel in this role, we encourage you to apply. Be part of a team that is driving the future of intelligent automotive solutions.

  


*Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.*

title: Java Developer [F/M/X]
description:
**Who are we?**
---------------

**Amaris Consulting** is an independent technology consulting firm providing guidance and solutions to businesses. With more than 1,000 clients across the globe, we have been rolling out solutions in major projects for over a decade – this is made possible by an international team of 7,600 people spread across 5 continents and more than 60 countries. Our solutions focus on four different Business Lines: Information System & Digital, Telecom, Life Sciences and Engineering. We’re focused on building and nurturing a top talent community where all our team members can achieve their full potential. Amaris is your steppingstone to cross rivers of change, meet challenges and achieve all your projects with success.  

  

At Amaris, we strive to provide our candidates with the best possible recruitment experience. We like to get to know our candidates, challenge them, and be able to give them proper feedback as quickly as possible. Here's what our recruitment process looks like:
  

  

**Brief Call**: Our process typically begins with a brief virtual/phone conversation to get to know you! The objective? Learn about you, understand your motivations, and make sure we have the right job for you!
  

  

**Interviews** (the average number of interviews is 3 - the number may vary depending on the level of seniority required for the position). During the interviews, you will meet people from our team: your line manager of course, but also other people related to your future role. We will talk in depth about you, your experience, and skills, but also about the position and what will be expected of you. Of course, you will also get to know Amaris: our culture, our roots, our teams, and your career opportunities!
  

  

**Case study**: Depending on the position, we may ask you to take a test. This could be a role play, a technical assessment, a problem-solving scenario, etc.
  

  

As you know, every person is different and so is every role in a company. That is why we have to adapt accordingly, and the process may differ slightly at times. However, please know that we always put ourselves in the candidate's shoes to ensure they have the best possible experience.
  

We look forward to meeting you!
**Job description**
-------------------

You will be part of the One Engine Software download team and we are perhaps working with the most exciting digital product right now, i.e. enabling upgrade of cars over the air, cable and Wi-Fi Anywhere. Anytime.  

Today there are one team working in the product, situated in Gothenburg. We believe in the power of WE and co-creation and do most of our work in our Torslanda team place but there is also a possibility to balance on-site work with work from home.  

It is not a coincidence that we say Volvo For Life. We make sure we have a warm and inclusive team culture mixed with personal development and many of us stay in the company for a long time either taking on larger responsibility in a product or expand into the ART or elsewhere in the company.


**What you’ll do**  

In the OE team you will be part of an agile environment where you as a developer are empowered to bring requirements all the way from the reviewing stage to production ready functionality, while also working with code reviews and setting up plans for how to architect our code to have top notch quality and allow for quick changes.

  


**Do You Fit the Profile?** We believe that you are proficient in both backend and frontend development, with a primary focus on Java. You enjoy solving complex technical problems and know how to build scalable and high-performing solutions. Your experience includes working with databases such as MongoDB and Cosmos DB, and you are familiar with CI/CD pipelines. You are also skilled in Kubernetes, TypeScript, Azure Cloud Services, and Angular. Understanding agile team principles is essential.


**Qualifications:**


* Expertise in Java (primary focus).
* Experience with backend and frontend development.
* Knowledge of databases like MongoDB and Cosmos DB.
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines.
* Proficiency in Kubernetes, TypeScript, Azure Cloud Services, and Angular.
* Solid understanding of UX/UI principles.
* Agile team experience and familiarity with agile principles.
* Ability to manage requirements from the review stage to production-ready functionality.


**Preferred/Bonus Skills:**


* Knowledge of .Net/C#.
* Experience in direct client management.
* Network programming (e.g., TCP/UDP, vehicle protocols like CAN, CAN-FD, DoIP, UDS).
* Windows desktop application development (WinUI/WPF).
* DevOps scenarios in business-critical consumer environments.
* Passion for user needs and user journey.
* Strong understanding of scalable and well-performing solution development.
* Experience in automotive software and over-the-air updates.

  


**Who You Are:** You are a curious and open-minded individual who continuously strives to develop your skillsets. You are willing to develop a T-shaped profile by expanding your knowledge into one or more other specializations. You are self-motivated and capable of networking with stakeholders for technical elicitation. You will stand out if you have experience in DevOps scenarios in a business-critical consumer environment.

  


*Amaris Consulting is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to promoting diversity within the workforce and creating an inclusive working environment. For this purpose, we welcome applications from all qualified candidates regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or other characteristics.*

title: Mjukvaruutvecklare
description:
Cyber Design Nordics AB är en fåmansbolag som jobbar främst med IT utveckling inom bank och finans. Vi jobbar med innovativa lösningar för våra kunder och främst jobbar vi på plats hos våra kunder. Vi ser gärna att du är en innovativ person som älskar att jobba med utmanade tekniker och är öppen att lära dig nya saker. Du är bra att kommunicera med andra och trivs både med att arbeta enskild och i grupp.

Du har erfarenhet av Spring, Springboot, MongoDB, Cassandra, Linux, micro services, react, react native, test automation och vill jobba i ett mindre bolag med varierade arbetsuppgifter.

title: AI Developer for generative code models
description:
Artificial intelligence is transforming society. AI Sweden is the national center for applied artificial intelligence and our mission is to accelerate the use of AI for the benefit of our society, our competitiveness, and for everyone living in Sweden. We drive impactful initiatives in areas such as healthcare, energy, and the public sector while pushing the boundaries of AI research and innovation in fields such as natural language processing and edge learning. Join us in harnessing the untapped value of AI to drive innovation and create sustainable value for Sweden.


We are now looking for a **AI developer for a project on generative code models in our NLU team**.

### **About the position**


AI Sweden is part of a project on developing generative code models for the automotive industry. The project will investigate the intersection between generative code models and formal code verification techniques, and we aim to develop a novel type of verification-driven generative code model.


In the role as an AI developer, you will focus on generative code models based on the Transformer architecture. You will work in Sweden’s leading research group on Large Language Models (the NLU group at AI Sweden), and you will encounter a range of stimulating technical challenges and develop some of the most sought-after technical skills in the industry. You’ll be working in a highly stimulating environment where your creativity and power of initiative is not just welcomed, but essential. This position is perfect for those who want to apply their programming skills and inventiveness to cutting-edge development of Transformer-based code models.


We encourage female applicants, and we aim to fill the position as soon as possible.

### **We believe that as a person you’re**

**Inquisitive Learner:** Passionate about AI and machine learning, you are driven by a desire to continually learn and stay on top of the latest developments.

**Practical Problem Solver:** With a talent for innovative solutions, you see past challenges and focus on constructive outcomes. Your approach combines practicality with creativity.

**Effective Communicator:** Your ability to convey complex ideas clearly is important. We highly value a knowledge-sharing culture within our diverse team.

### **And workwise, you are**

**Strong Programmer:** You have excellent and proven programming skills in Python and preferably also C and C++.

**Practical Deep Learner:** You have previous experience working with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch. HPC experience is a plus.

**Experienced Transformer:** You have previously worked with Transformer-based models. It’s a plus if you have worked with autoregressive Transformers and code models.

**Agile Implementer & Tester:** Quick to grasp and understand new machine learning techniques and trends, you'll experiment with cutting-edge techniques alongside our team.

### **Why work for AI Sweden?**


To us, artificial intelligence is not only about tech, it’s a force for positive societal change. You'll be working alongside leading AI experts, scientists, journalists, linguists, policy professionals, entrepreneurs, change leaders, and many more. To work here, you don’t need to know “everything” about AI, but you need to believe in its potential to help shape our society for the better.


As an organization, we’re uniquely positioned at the sweet spot of governmental influence and startup agility. Small enough to stay adaptive and have fun but backed by and in close contact with both the government, academia and private and public sector.


Join us to make a real-world impact by contributing to initiatives that benefit society and tackle critical challenges. Be at the forefront of AI innovation, working with cutting-edge technologies and playing a key role in shaping the future of AI in Sweden.


And, within our mission, we can most certainly be a platform empowering you to realize your ideas. AI Sweden’s ability to empower partners and individual team members to do exceedingly well in their profession is a key success factor for driving positive and significant impact.


In short, we like to believe we offer our team members a place to grow, an environment for personal development.

### **An equal and fair working environment**


We strongly believe in diversity and inclusion and are acutely aware of the skewed gender balance in our industry. We actively strive to put together a diverse team in terms of age, gender and background.


Naturally, we’re under a collective agreement (“kollektivavtal”) and offer everything that comes with it in terms of annual leave, pensions, wellness allowance (“friskvårdsbidrag”), and such.

**Application Deadline**: we will evaluate candidates continuously.


If you have any questions or thoughts, don’t hesitate to contact **Magnus Sahlgren, Research Manager, NLU**.

 *AI Sweden does not accept unsolicited support and kindly ask not to be contacted by any advertisement agents, recruitment agencies or manning companies.*

title: Erfaren Systemutvecklare
description:
#### **Erfaren Systemutvecklare**

  

Vi söker dig som gillar att lösa komplexa problem och skapa kod som verkligen gör skillnad i sitt sammanhang. För dig är det inte bara viktigt att koden fungerar – det ska vara hållbart, skalbart och skapa långsiktigt värde.


Du har djup kunskap om vilka kodmönster som passar bäst i olika situationer och vet hur man bygger system som minimerar teknisk skuld. Med en förståelse för vad som utgör en stabil infrastruktur och hur man reducerar risken för buggar, lägger du grunden för robust och pålitlig mjukvara.


Som person tror vi att du är nyfiken och motiverad att lära dig nya tekniker och utvecklas i din roll. Med en gedigen utbildning och flera års erfarenhet inom systemutveckling har du byggt upp en bred verktygslåda som gör dig trygg i att hantera utmaningar ur ett utvecklarperspektiv.  

  



**Tech-stack och områden vi är mest intresserade av (men erfarenhet av andra språk fungerar ofta också):**

  

* tech stack: C# / .NET, Java / Kotlin, Python, Node.js, React.js, Next.js, Typescript
* arkitektur: microservices, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), event-driven architecture, SOA, API architecture, Enterprise Application Integration
* infrastruktur: DevOps, CI/CD, säkerhet
* mobile development: React Native, Flutter
* cloud teknologier, molntjänster: AWS, Azure, Google Cloud
* integration med hårdvara


Vi uppmuntrar ansökningar från personer av alla kön och bakgrunder för att återspegla den mångfald som finns inom vårt företag och samhället stort.


Du behöver tala svenska och engelska på en professionell nivå och ha rättighet att bo och arbeta i Sverige.

  


#### **Vilka är Drakryggen?**


Vi på Drakryggen vill göra saker som är roliga eller viktiga. Och utvecklande. Ibland är det vi gör både roligt och viktigt samtidigt som det är utvecklande. Då har vi lyckats.


Du kanske undrar vad vi menar med viktigt? Vi tänker att allt som bidrar till de 17 globala hållbarhetsmålen är viktigt.

**Men vad jobbar vi med på Drakryggen?** Jo, vi är konsulter som bygger system som är baserade på mjukvara. Ofta sitter vi ute hos våra kunder och skapar värde med hjälp av vår kompetens inom mjukvaruutveckling. Ibland arbetar vi tillsammans internt på Drakryggen med vad vi kallar inhouse-projekt. Det känns viktigt att till och från att kunna arbeta tillsammans när vi spenderar merparten av vår tid i externa kunduppdrag. I ett inhouse-projekt byggde vi en **interaktiv lekpark**.

#### **Vad kan vi erbjuda?**

Vi tror på en hälsosam arbetslivsbalans och en prestigelös miljö som bidrar till teamets utveckling. Du får inom rimliga ramar fri arbetsplats och flexibel arbetstid. Vi ger dig möjligheter att utveckla nya färdigheter i en inkluderande arbetsmiljö tillsammans med proffsiga och ödmjuka kollegor.


Du kan läsa mer om oss som redan jobbar på Drakryggen på vår **hemsida**.

title: Junior Radio Software Developer
description:
Are you a developer who want to join the software development for Ericsson's market leading Radios? We are looking for talented developers that are curious and ready to be on the cutting edge of technology.


The responsibility for Radio Products Sweden is to bring next generation radio products, with the latest technology to the market. Our organization is focusing on the SW solutions for the new HW platforms that will be deployed in 5G/6G networks globally.

**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


We are looking for junior software developer who would join the cross-functional team working on the development of the Radio Software that controls Radio Units used for communication between mobile devices (smartphones, etc.) and vendors providing telecommunication services (data, voice, etc).


Development is mostly done in C++ and Java JCat, and it is used to create and maintain functionalities in the complex system architecture with SW and HW components for the Radio Unit that is embedded device.

 **You will:**

* Work in a self-organizing cross-functional agile team with responsibility from pre-study to release and customer acceptance for new functionality
* Do SW development in C++ in a complex system architecture with SW and HW components
* Get understanding of the sophisticated system and fix difficult problems
* Work outside your own subject area
* Contribute with competence in SW system design and architecture principles
* Develop and utilize test automation, preferably using Java

 **The skills you bring:**

* A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical or Electronic Engineering or Wireless Communication or equivalent
* 1-2 years of meaningful work experience in SW development. You can be newly graduated.
* Willingness to broaden your competence and get a deeper understanding of our products
* Knowledge and experience in programming using object-oriented languages C++ and Java
* Knowledge on HW near programming
* Competence in Linux
* Familiarity with Jenkins, GIT, Eclipse, VScode
* Understanding of continuous integration, test and troubleshooting skills in the radio domain
* Good speaking and writing skills in English
 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Digital Hardware developer
description:
We are looking for a digital hardware designer with knowledge of hardware design


that wants to join our team in Stockholm, Sweden.

  

Your primary role will be to work on digital and frequency generation design activities within our radio product development at the Ericsson design center in Sweden (Kista) and cooperate with our global sites in China and Canada.


Your role will include activities such as: circuit design, verification and product documentation as well as interacting with software design, integration, verification, tools design, and product lifecycle management.

**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**

* Work with radio digital&FG design from architecture to volume production
* Support with hardware design&test introduction into the factory
* Investigate and resolve engineering problems
* Drive continuous improvements of design, processes and product quality
* Prepare lab environment including both equipment and software components
* Implement test and validation methods for efficient design test coverage
* Produce documentation as per radio development processes
* Perform troubleshooting, including support on debugging field return units

 **To be successful in the role, you must have****:**

* Graduated with a minimum of B.Sc. or equivalent in electrical engineering or physics
* Experience with layout and schematic tool (e.g. Cadence)
* Experience with high-speed serial interfaces(e.g PCIE, DDR, JESD)
* Excellent communication skills in English
* Ability to excel in a fast-paced diverse team environment
 **You might also have:**

* Previous exposure to radio transceiver digital design and/or test
* Experience with simulation tools (e.g Mentor, Ansys, SiSoft)
* Experience in hardware implementation and verification for multilayer mixed digital/analog /RF designs
* Experience with lab equipment such as logic analyser, oscilloscope, Signal source analyzer, spectrum analyzer etc.
* Experience with EMC/timing analysis/constraints

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. title: Baseband Developer with Test focus
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


When joining at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead, and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology. This is a place where you're welcomed as your own perfectly unique self, and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team.Together with your team you will be responsible from pre-study to customer acceptance for new functionality, together with maintenance of current products. The team systemizes, designs and tests the software and takes joint responsibility for all team tasks.  

  

One part of the position is about to together with your team be responsible from pre-study to customer acceptance for new functionality, together with maintenance of current products. The team systemizes, designs and tests the software and takes joint responsibility for all team tasks. The other part is to together with test leaders in the domain take responsibility for test-related matters such as test-frameworks and tools, test coverage and test strategies.

 **What you will do:**

  

Your focus will be in Physical layer (L1) parts of the Baseband SW and the domain testing of the same, vital building blocks in our market leading 5G Radio Access Network (RAN) solution and in future within 6G. Together with your fellow baseband SW developers, you will:

* 2+ years of industry experience who want to be part of Radio Baseband software development for 5G and 6G.
* Build outstanding baseband software using C/C++, Python.
* Participate in the study, implementation, and verification of new 5G features and, in the near future, within 6G.
* Work in a multi-functional, multi-cultural environment with supportive teammates.
* Work with domain test related matters together with the test-leaders in the domain.

 **The skills you bring:**

  

  

* A Master of Science degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, Wireless Communication, Electrical or Electronic Engineering or equivalent.


- 2 - 5 years of industry experience preferably within telecom or similar industry working with embedded software development.  

* Experience and interest in the test area. Passion for quality and continuous improvements in test
* Curiosity, a desire, and skills to be a great embedded software developer with a special interest in the C/C++ programming language for real time systems.
* Knowledge and experience in 5G and 4G wireless communication e.g. 3GPP specifications.
* Experience with signal processing, RF or air interface measurements, multi-core DSP processor programming in areal-time environment and design patterns in an embedded environment.
* A forward-thinking, hardworking, and creative personality. We love extraordinary teammates who enjoy a fast-paced work environment and adopts challenge.
* Dedication and a genuine interest in the latest technology trends and a passion to solve complex problems no one else has solved before.

title: Microsoft Dynamics 365 Utvecklare
description:
**Vi letar efter en verksamhetsutvecklare som kan Dynamics 365 och Power Platform. Om du är en engagerad person som förstår hur teknik och verksamhet går hand i hand. Då är du välkommen att höra av dig till oss på Innofactor Solutions.**

**Vi söker en driven konsult som tillsammans med teamet kan bidra med att optimera affärsprocesser, säkra upp leveranser och skapa goda kundrelationer.**

**Är det här du?**
  

Vi tror att du har arbetat i minst 2–3 år och har erfarenhet av projekt inom Dynamics och Power Platform och kan hantera dessa. Du har förmodligen påbörjat din resa inom projektledning och du arbetar främst agilt. Som person beskriver du dig själv som relationsskapande och du är tydlig i din kommunikation. Du drivs av din inre kompass och känner dig trygg i att fatta beslut men förstår att samarbete med andra är en förutsättning för att nå framgång i projektet


**Ansvarsområden:**


* Delta i teamets leveranser och säkerställa effektiv planering och samordning.
* Hantera projektbudgetar, sätta upp roadmap tillsammans med produktägaren och resursfördelning.
* Planera leveranser och upprätthålla starka kundrelationer och kommunikation.
* Leda och delta i agila projekt, säkerställa att alla projektmoment genomförs enligt tidsplan och budget.
* Bidra till kompetensutveckling genom att dela insikter och erfarenheter med teamet och själv hålla dig uppdaterad genom utbildningar och certifieringar.

**Som konsult hos oss på Solutions kommer du att:**

* Optimera affärsprocesser med hjälp av verktyg inom Power Platform och applikationer inom Dynamics 365.
* Samla in och analysera krav samt designa och presentera tekniska lösningar, konfigurera och eventuellt utveckla med low code.
* Samordna med tekniska utvecklare och arkitekter och samarbeta med kunden för att säkerställa att lösningarna möter affärsbehoven.
* Implementera och utveckla Dynamics CRM och Power Platform-lösningar utifrån kundens behov.

Vi söker dig som har en kombination av teknisk kompetens och ledarförmåga där du vill du växa i rollen som scrum master eller projektledare. Har du erfarenhet inom Azure är meriterande.


**Har du dessutom några av dessa certifieringar** så står du högt på vår lista


* PL-200 (Power Platform)
* MB-210 (Sales)
* MB-220 (Marketing)
* MB-230 (Customer Service)
* Azure Fundamentals (Azure-certifiering, meriterande)
* Projektledningscertifiering t.ex. Scrum, SAFe (meriterande)

**På Innofactor Norden arbetar nästan 600 engagerade** och professionella experter i Sverige, Norge, Finland och Danmark. Det som förenar oss är vårt intresse för innovation och den senaste tekniken. I Sverige är vi cirka 70 anställda med kontor i centralt i Stockholm samt Göteborg och Malmö. Vi har konsulter som jobbar med Dynamics 365, Power Platform, Cloud, infrastruktur, dataanalys och AI, cybersäkerhet, Microsoft 365, Azure med mera**.**


Vi är också mycket stolta över våra helt egna produkter t.ex. Sveriges ledande medlemssystem för fackligt ansluta och ett ärendehanteringssystem som är störst inom offentlig sektor i Finland som är på väg att ta den svenska marknaden med storm.


**Be the real you!**  

Vi är stolta över det vi skapar och låter våra medarbetare utvecklas som personer samtidigt som vi levererar högsta möjliga kvalitet till våra kunder. Vår arbetsmiljö stödjer de anställdas personliga utveckling och lärande, en god balans mellan arbete och privatliv.


Välkommen med din ansökan till Innofactor! **Och du - sök redan idag, vi anställer löpande!**

title: Backend developer
description:
**Are you our next backend developer?** 




 Come join us at Kivra! We’re looking for people with a passion for software development, love solving problems, and that thrive in agile development environments. We have grown tremendously and are looking for backend developers to help us scale! You’ll be part of building a scalable platform using functional languages like Erlang and Elixir. 
 



 At Kivra, we are building services that connect over 6 million people, by providing a safe and accessible digital infrastructure that everyone in Sweden can trust and use. At the same time, we are saving trees - reducing the paper that is printed and transported - by providing a better digital alternative to physical paper communication.
 



**What you’ll be doing** 




 You’ll join one of Kivra’s feature or platform teams, and work to develop features/services (both new and existing) to meet the needs, and solve the problems, of our users and senders. Security, reliability, and scalability are three areas we value highly and that serve as a foundation for our services; and central to the work you’ll do.
 



 Our services deal with large amounts of users, data and transactions daily, and our objective is to do so with 100% availability. We believe in doing things smart, simple and open source - and this is reflected in our tech stack. 
 



 Our platform and core is built on Erlang and Riak. We believe that you are curious about functional programming and are excited about the idea of working with programming languages such as Erlang and Elixir on a daily basis. 
 



 Moreover, we have adopted the Devops Methodology and strongly believe in the “You build it - you own it”-attitude. You will be actively involved in developing, testing, deploying and incident management, contributing to the overall success of the team. In that regard we utilize Docker, Kubernetes, PostgreSQL, GCP, Kafka, Github, and more. 
 



**What we’re looking for** 




 Knowledge is important but so is attitude! Kivra’s culture is strongly influenced by kindness, drive and the desire to produce high-quality work. How you fit in with your team is super important, and just like us, we believe that you thrive on being nice, helpful and always encouraging growth. 
 



 Moreover we believe that you: 
 


* Are a do-er that gets excited about developing new ideas and proposing innovative solutions
* Use feedback and reflection to develop self-awareness, personal and professional strengths as well as address new development areas
* Can collaborate with other product teams to help and provide the best end-user experience
* Review your work and that of others for quality, accuracy and relevance
* Use straightforward feedback, in a structured and constructive way, when communicating with others
* Seek opportunities to automate and document your work



 Moreover, we value previous experience in agile methodology and that you enjoy working within all aspects of agile development. To solve problems we strive to pair-program when possible and we think that you have the same mindset. Just like us, you are passionate about your craft and take ownership over your own development. 
 



**We offer** 




 Kivra offers a role in a caring and committed team, in a company that is growing and continuously innovating. You’ll join a warm and friendly culture that thrives on collaboration and teamwork. You will be involved in shaping and influencing a product currently used by more than half of Sweden’s population.
 



 We offer competitive remuneration and great benefits. Read more about our core values and benefits here: https://jobs.kivra.dev/!  
 



**How to apply** 




 Easy peasy, just send in your CV and cover letter as soon as possible. If you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact Andreas Nilsson, Talent Acquisition Partner at Andreas.Nilsson@kivra.com!

title: Game developer
description:
We are now looking for the best game developer to join us! You have the chance to be a part of creating the best casino games in the online slot industry!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and maintain Casino Games for both desktop and mobile browsers
* The technologies you primarily will work with are HTML5, WebGL, Typescript, Pixi, GSAP and Javascript.
* In a team environment that consists of product management, graphic artistry, sound creation, server development and game mechanics, you will contribute to deliver the best casino games in the market today.
* Your main responsibilities are to make the game graphics come alive with spectacular animations, game flow, game mechanics and sounds according to a result delivered by our game servers.


 Who you are
   

  

* You are a Master Google Searcher that have Stackoverflow as your absolute favourite web site.
* You have practical experience of working with OOP in some language and you have a pragmatic approach to software development.
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in.
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you.
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and take ownership of changes from editor to production system.


 Beneficial skills
   

  

* Working experience of mobile browsers and knowledge about their limitations and how they work in different ways is a big plus.


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Back End Developer
description:
**About the job** 




  





 Nordomatic is a Global Pioneer within Smart Buildings with operations in Sweden, Denmark, Norway, the UK, the Netherlands, Belgium, USA and India. We have been around since 1967, we are more than 1000 specialists at 33 different offices, and we are proud say that we are one of the world’s leading independent BMS providers.
 



 Cloud and SaaS provide a wide range of new opportunities for property owners to reduce energy consumption, improve indoor air quality and provide necessary data and analytics to certify buildings and operations according to LEED, BREEAM, WELL, etc. Nordomatic Property Tech is the software division of Nordomatic delivering cloud solutions for properties around the globe, bringing together hardware and software solutions to help companies manage their BMS, Workplace and Energy in the cloud.
 



  





**About the Role** 




 As a Backend Developer, you will join a small but highly skilled team of engineers. You'll work with a variety of internal and external services products, with the majority of the focus dedicated to new services development and infrastructure-related activities. Your contributions will significantly shape the product, and if you have a passion for specific areas such as Coud Services tech design or Data Management, there are opportunities to take practical growth in those domains. The hunger to learn is really appreciated.
 



  





**About You** 




 You have at least 3 years of experience developing backend services for commercial software products using Java. You’ve been working with SQL DBs and have experience with GCP / Azure. You are passionate about coding, produce clean and efficient code, and stay updated on the latest frameworks, tools, and methodologies.
 



  





 We are taking quality seriously and you expected to cover your code with proper test coverage including SIT. Practical experience with WebSockets is a strong plus.
 



  





 Given the collaborative nature of this core team role, we prefer candidates who live within a reasonable commuting distance from our Solna office, allowing for occasional in-person team interactions.
 



  





**What We Offer** 




 Join a small but technically advanced team where you can have a significant impact on the product we're building.

title: Senior Developer
description:
**About the job** 




 Are you ready to step into a world full of innovation and opportunities? Looking for the next step in your career? Look no further!
 



  





 We are now seeking new colleagues for Rocket. At Rocket, the belief is that companies exist for people – not the other way around. We are looking for you, a
 **Senior Developer** 
 , to join their dynamic team and their journey forward!
 



  





 Whether they’re diving into complex new technologies or heading out on their next surfing or skiing adventure, your team at Rocket champions transforming complexity into simplicity and enjoyment. You’ll be working with amazing people and exciting technology, having fun, being innovative, and creating outstanding products and services in areas like automation, full-stack development, cloud services & DevOps, and security.
 



  





 In your role as a
 **Senior Developer** 
 , you’ll work on exciting projects for their clients while also having the chance to hone your skills on fun internal projects – which Rocket will happily tell you more about! 
 



  





**Who are you?** 




 We’re looking for a true tech enthusiast at heart – a self-proclaimed nerd with a lifelong passion for technology. You didn’t pursue education just for its sake but because technology is part of your DNA. Your innate talent for tech stands out – you have a knack for diving deep into new technologies and quickly getting up to speed.
 



  





 You’re an experienced front- or backend developer with at least five years under your belt and are ready to take the next step in your career. You’re proficient in at least one high-level programming techniques, such as Python, Java, C/C++/C#, .NET, JavaScript, Ruby, React, Angular, Node, Vue, or Bootstrap, and you have solid experience designing and developing REST APIs. Additionally, you’re well-versed in cloud technologies like App Services and Functions. 
 



  





 Working with modern CI/CD pipelines such as CircleCI, GitHub Actions, and Jenkins is second nature to you. You’re fluent in both Swedish and English. The job is located in the greater Stockholm metropolitan area and therefore not looking for people for a remote employees.
 



  





 Your skills in software architecture, design, implementation, and deployment will be invaluable to the team and future projects.
 



 To top it off, we see it as a bonus if you have:
 


* Experience as a consultant
* Design skills (HTML5, CSS, SCSS, SVG, dynamic layouts, etc.)
* Knowledge in RPA & Automation
* Experience in Machine Learning
* Database expertise



  





**What can Rocket offer you?** 



* **Partnership** 
 🤝 – Influence the company’s future, participate in internal development projects, and even have the opportunity for future ownership.
* **Innovation** 
 💡 – Rocket loves innovation and working on internal development projects.
* **Occupational Health Services** 
 🌡️ – Comprehensive health care coverage.
* **Exciting Conferences** 
 🌍 – Fantastic adventure conferences and getaways with colleagues.
* **Flexibility** 
 🏡 – Rocket is highly flexible. A typical week includes a few days at the client site, one or two days in the office, and one day working from home.
* **Social Gatherings** 
 🥳 – Social events and games to connect with colleagues.
* **Central Office** 
 🏢 – A startup-style office located centrally for your convenience, close to public transport, just a minute from Östermalmstorg station.



  





  





**Performance, Kindness & Trust - Rocket**

title: Fullstack Developer - Application Services
description:
Clean-energy tech leads to a positive global transformation. Heating homes contribute to 15% of Europe's CO2 emissions. Switching to sustainable solutions offers households a way to achieve net-zero emissions.
   

  

 Aira's mission is to advance the next generation of home energy solutions, creating intelligent, sustainable homes for a meaningful impact. Starting with innovative heat pumps, it will evolve into a comprehensive, intelligent clean energy-tech system and include dynamic electrical tariffs, cutting-edge home solar systems, and advanced battery storage solutions.
   

  

 Founded in 2022 with already 1300 employees and growing, Aira aims to drive the clean energy revolution. We are headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, and our factory in Poland brings these innovations to life, with operating markets in the UK, Italy, and Germany.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Join our expanding Engagement area and play a key role in the Application Services team as a Full-stack Developer creating, expanding and maintaining web as well as mobile apps that make for an exceptional Aira experience.
   

  

**The focus of the Application Services team is to create world-class product-driven software for both: our customers** 
 – end users of Aira’s green energy tech –
 **and our internal users** 
 such as Aira heat pump installers.
   

  

 On one hand, these apps need to be clean, easy to use and intuitive to enable effortless UX. However, at the same time, they must integrate, distribute, and efficiently manage multi-channel live data points (including IoT) and offer them internally via APIs to enable Aira product readiness in daily operations and support customers in making informed energy decisions.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing** 
  

  

  

* Writing, maintaining and enhancing clean, scalable code including thorough testing
* Using Kotlin to design, implement and maintain back-end services that serve the app and distribute the data in microservice architecture
+ experience in Kotlin is nice to have – experience in similar modern languages such as Java, Go or NodeJS is sufficient

* Building real-time streaming data pipelines and real-time streaming applications with Kafka
* Collaborating with other Aira Engagement teams (Connectivity, IoT), and implementing integrations with e.g., external energy tariffs providers and upcoming projects related to expanding Aira green tech solutions portfolio
* Demonstrating expertise in system architecture, (relational and non-relational) database design, AWS cloud operations as well as building and integrating APIs
* Contributing to the implementation of app features using Flutter, including handling user accounts, providing, and supporting integrations with Identity Providers for both installers and customers
+ Flutter proficiency is nice to have, experience in other enterprise-grade front-end tools is fine for collaborating back-to-front

* Actively engaging in ongoing discussions regarding design and device lifecycles
* Applying Agile methodologies and collaborating in cross-functional teams


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy working in our brand new office. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan subway station just a few minutes walk away.


 Aira leads in the next generation of Energy. We are driven by our belief that the power of diversity fuels innovation. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team, united in our mission to create a better future for society and the planet.

title: Fullstack / Frontend Developer - Planning and Solution Design
description:
Clean-energy tech leads to a positive global transformation. Heating homes contribute to 15% of Europe's CO2 emissions. Switching to sustainable solutions offers households a way to achieve net-zero emissions.
   

  

 Aira's mission is to advance the next generation of home energy solutions, creating intelligent, sustainable homes for a meaningful impact. Starting with innovative heat pumps, it will evolve into a comprehensive, intelligent clean energy-tech system and include dynamic electrical tariffs, cutting-edge home solar systems, and advanced battery storage solutions.
   

  

 Founded in 2022 with already 700 employees and growing, Aira aims to drive the clean energy revolution. We are headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, and our factory in Poland brings these innovations to life, with operating markets in the UK, Italy, and Germany.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Fullstack Developer, you’ll play a central role in one of our product teams, within Aira’s Acquisition area. The focus of these teams is to craft web applications at the heart of Aira’s energy solution design and installation planning systems. These applications are fundamental to achieving a world-class customer experience and span across tools for designing the solutions, as well as planning and scheduling the installations. The team develops data products for modeling Aira's field force optimization as well as the tools to support installers on-site, at the customers' homes.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**

* Experience in automated testing to ensure application reliability and performance
* Experience writing backends in a classical object-oriented language like C# or Java


 We would also expect you to have experience in at least two of the following areas:
   

  

  

* Writing backend code in Java and Spring Boot
* Databases (e.g. DynamoDB/PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka)
* Cloud DevOps (AWS, Docker, Terraform, Kubernetes)

* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy working in our brand new office. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan subway station just a few minutes walk away.
