title: Project Manager - Development
description:
Do you have experience in project management and want to improve cancer care for patients around the world? Join RaySearch's development department as project manager!
   

  

**About The Position**
 As a project manager at RaySearch you will be part of the team that is responsible for planning, leading and documenting product development projects, ensuring that we provide our customers with state-of-the-art oncology software. We work according to agile methodologies and with close collaboration between projects and departments within RaySearch.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Plan the development projects and product releases together with fellow project management team members and other project management teams.
* Follow up project progress continuously together with the development teams
* Continuously work together with the development teams to improve processes and ways of working as well as to remove impediments
* Ensure that activities are performed, and documentation is produced according to our development process, including planning and participation in test management and risk management activities
* Communicate project status to relevant stakeholders


 Your profile
   

  

 We believe that you have a background in project management or experience from another leading role. To be successful in this position you should have a pragmatic approach to solving problems as they arise and be able to organize your work well. You enjoy facing new challenges and can find structure in a highly dynamic environment. We also believe that you have strong interpersonal and communication skills. You are capable of handling and prioritizing many requests and relations at once. You are used to working proactively and taking initiatives and you enjoy cross-functional collaboration and teamwork.
   

  

**Requirements**
* BSc or MSc degree in engineering, or equivalent
* 3+ years’ experience in project management within software development
* Previous experience of agile methodologies
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills (English and Swedish)


**Meriting**
* Medtech industry experience
* Experience working in Azure DevOps Server


**Our Culture**
 Culture at RaySeach is the driving force behind our organization
 **, where** 
 everything we do is driven by a shared passion for innovation and the fight against cancer. Our dedication is reflected in our ability
 **to deliver** 
 exceptional results,
 **pay** 
 close attention to detail, and consistently
 **go** 
 the extra mile. Our employees stand out as experts in
 **their** 
 field
 **, driven by** 
 a relentless focus on solving problems
 **-** 
 no matter how complex. At RaySearch, we take pride in
 **leading the way in** 
 cancer treatment, leveraging cutting-edge technology to develop innovative
 **solutions** 
 that make a real difference in patient care.
   

  

**Our Offer**
 At RaySearch, we offer a diverse and inclusive work environment, fostering openness, sincerity, and collaboration. Located in Hagastaden, Stockholm's Life Science Hub, our modern and creative workspace includes an in-house gym, yoga, and social activities like ping pong, table football, and regular after-work events. Our bistro serves a fantastic lunch buffet, and we offer morning- and afternoon-fika every day. Our rooftop terrace also provides a stunning 360-degree view of Stockholm, enhancing the work experience. All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package.
   

  

 Application
   

  

 Please apply for the position through the application form below. Selection and interviews will be ongoing. We do not accept applications by e-mail.

title: Senior Cloud IP Network DevOps Engineer
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Want to embark on a new career journey where you can make a real impact? I'm Marko Onikki, and I'm searching for a curious individual like you, ready to leave a lasting mark. Join our team, where your skills will thrive, and together – let's make better happen!
   

  

**As a Cloud IP Network DevOps Engineer…**
 You will continue to evolve our network cloud platform and do this by using the latest technologies in this area. You’ll be part of the Connectivity & Delivery Team, responsible for building Cloud infrastructure and providing connectivity to our customers in Telia’s Network Cloud footprint in Denmark, Estonia, Finland, Lithuania, Norway and Sweden. Our team works with the HW/SW components of the cloud stack including IP connectivity to the tenant applications. This is a great opportunity for a candidate to grow and contribute to our softwarization journey.
   

  

 You will be responsible for developing and maintaining Telia’s cloud-based IP network solutions. Your role will involve designing, implementing, and supporting network infrastructure to ensure high availability and scalability. You will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to deliver advanced network solutions, drive automation initiatives, and optimize operations.
   

  

**Who We're Looking For**
 We are looking for a proactive and technically skilled professional with a strong background in IP networking and cloud environments. You are forward-thinking and adaptable, with a passion for continuous improvement and collaboration in a DevOps setting.
   

  

 You bring extensive experience with IP network solutions, including routing and switching, and a solid understanding of private cloud technologies (VMware) and processes. Your hands-on expertise with utilizing Infrastructure as Code to automate operations (IaC/config mgmt tools (Ansible, Terraform), APIs (REST API, gRPC), CICD tools (Jenkins), Version control (Git, Github), containerization (Docker, Podman). Additionally, you are proficient in scripting languages and programming languages such as Python or Bash and Sys administration (RHEL, Centos, Ubuntu). Fluency in English, both spoken and written, is required.
   

  

 Knowledge of network protocols (TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, HHTP/HTTPS, SSL, BGP, MPLS) and VPN technologies, as well as an understanding of network security principles (FW, ACL), is also important. Experience with container orchestration platforms like Kubernetes or Docker would be a valuable asset. CCIE or at least CCNP certified ideally in Service Provider track or Routing & Switching / Enterprise. Relevant knowledge/experience is also a qualifier. Fluent English in both speaking and writing is necessary.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 We are looking forward to your application by 2025-02-06. If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our Hiring Manager/Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.
   

  

 If you want to know more about this position, please contact me at marko.onikki@teliacompany.com.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together**

title: Systemutvecklare med DevOps kunskaper
description:
**Vill du vara med och bidra till ett säkrare samhälle?** 




 Basalt är ett av branschens ledande säkerhetsföretag med senior expertis inom IT-säkerhet, informationssäkerhet, krisberedskap och totalförsvar samt systematiskt säkerhetsskyddsarbete. Vi har även marknadens säkraste IT-plattform/PaaS, Craton, för organisationer med de högsta skyddskraven.
 



  





 Just nu befinner vi oss i en stark tillväxtfas och behöver därför förstärka vårt team med dig som vill arbeta med att utveckla nästa generation av Craton, eller arbeta som systemintegratör inom Säkra system.
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Basalt levererar totallösningar för organisationer som inte kan använda vanliga IT-system på grund av högt ställda skyddskrav. Craton uppfyller de högsta kvalitets- och säkerhetskraven på marknaden.
 



  





 Hos oss kommer du ingå i ett team som arbetar med att utveckla och leverera Craton till våra kunder. Vi arbetar agilt och hos oss kommer du får du få möjligheten att utvecklas i nära samarbete i ett av våra team med kunniga kollegor som alla brinner för att utveckla nästa generation av Craton. Craton är byggd som en private cloud-lösning för hela systemmiljöer, och är mer metod än teknikval. Vi arbetar med integration av system, orkestrering, helautomatiserade miljöer, samt microservices mm. Läs mer om Basalts it-plattform
 **Craton här** 
 .
 



  





 Vi är i en tillväxtfas och du har därför möjlighet att påverka ansvar i din roll utifrån dina intressen och din bakgrund.
 



  





**Din bakgrund** 




 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av DevOps/utveckling i automatiserade och komplexa IT-miljöer. Vi ser gärna att du är intresserad av att bygga lösningar i Ansible-miljö.
 



 Du är en kommunikativ lagspelare som trivs med att diskutera tekniska lösningar och är nyfiken på att lära dig ny teknik. Du har goda Linuxkunskaper och erfarenhet av programmering i något modernt språk. Du drivs av att utvecklas både tekniskt och som person, och har ett intresse för IT-säkerhet. För att du ska trivas i rollen har du ett intresse för infrastruktur, systemintegrationer och nätverk/kommunikation, då Craton är en helhetslösning. Dokumentation är centralt i vårt arbete, så du behöver kunna uttrycka dig väl på både svenska och engelska, både i tal
 



 och skrift.
 



  





 Hos oss får du lära dig de specifika verktyg och system du behöver.
 



  





 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetande. Våra anställda är placerade i säkerhetsklass i enlighet med de krav som finns i Säkerhetsskyddslagen då våra kunders verksamhet kräver detta, vilket medför att svenskt medborgarskap är ett villkor för tjänsten.
 



  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 För att ge dig trygghet och stabilitet erbjuder vi ett förmånspaket som inkluderar en av marknadens bästa pensionslösningar, omfattande försäkringar, förstärkt föräldralön, och ett generöst friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr/år. Du får även tillgång till Benify, där du kan hitta extra förmåner och vi erbjuder kontinuerliga möjligheter till kompetensutveckling.
 



  





 Vi värnar om balansen mellan arbete och fritid. Med flexibla arbetstider, 5-timmars arbetsdag innan helgdagar och ledigt på klämdagar ser vi till att du har tid för både ditt jobb och ditt privatliv. Dessutom anordnar vi gemensamma aktiviteter, såsom skidresor, träningspass och sociala luncher, för att stärka sammanhållningen och göra arbetsplatsen ännu trevligare.
 



  





 Vi strävar efter att du ska känna stolthet och trivsel hos oss på Basalt. Du kan läsa mer om våra förmåner och om hur det är att arbeta på Basalt
 **här!** 




  





**Din ansökan** 




 Ansök med ditt CV och beskriv kort vad du söker i din nästa roll samt svara på urvalsfrågorna. Vi gör löpande urval och intervjuer så ansök gärna redan idag!
 



  





 Vill du veta mer om rollen? Kontakta gärna Kajsa-Stina Åkerblom på 076 763 99 97 eller på
 **kajsa-stina.akerblom@basalt.se** 




  





**Mer om oss** 




 Basalt är experter inom verksamhets- och säkerhetsskydd, med djup kunskap inom systematiskt säkerhetsarbete och utveckling av säkra IT-lösningar. Vi stödjer företag, myndigheter och kommuner i att skydda sin mest värdefulla information från både interna och externa hot. Grundat 2009 och med cirka 120 medarbetare, blev vi en del av Omegapoint Group 2022.
 



  





 Vår vision är att Basalt ska vara det självklara valet för att skapa ett säkert och robust samhälle. Våra värderingar bygger på att vara både vassa och snälla, vi kombinerar hög prestation och expertis med en kultur där vi bryr oss om varandra och skapar en positiv, stöttande miljö.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Cyber Security Engineer
description:
**Expleo** 
 is seeking a highly skilled and experienced
 **Senior DevSecOps Consultant** 
 to join our team in
 **Sweden** 
 (located in Gothenburg OR Stockholm).
   

  

 Our
 **ideal** 
 candidate has strong problem-solving skills, an analytical mindset and the ability to lead the integration of security into the development and operations processes.
   

  

 If you are a full-stack engineer looking to expand your skill set, we'd love to hear from you. Join our team today and take the next step in your career!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* DevSecOps Strategy Implementation : Support and implement a comprehensive DevSecOps strategy that aligns with organizational objectives and security standards.
* CI/CD Pipeline Security Integration : Integrate security tools and practices within CI/CD pipelines to automate security checks and ensure continuous security compliance.
* Security Automation and Orchestration : Design and implement security automation scripts and workflows to enhance the efficiency of the DevSecOps process.
* Infrastructure as Code (IaC) Security: Ensure security best practices are embedded in IaC scripts and configurations.
* Container and Microservices Security : Implement security measures for containerized applications and microservices architectures.
* Collaboration and Training : Work collaboratively with development and operations teams to build a strong DevSecOps culture; provide training and mentorship in security best practices.


**Qualifications**
* Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in DevSecOps, with a proven track record of implementing security in DevOps environments.
* Expertise in automation and orchestration tools (e.g., Jenkins, Ansible, Chef, Puppet).
* Proficient in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP) and understanding of cloud-native security principles.
* Good knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes) and their security configurations.
* Experience with infrastructure as code (Terraform, CloudFormation) and ensuring the security of IaC.
* Proficient in implementing and configuring security tools such as SAST, DAST, IAST, RASP, and vulnerability scanners.
* Familiarity with secure coding practices and application security standards.
* Strong understanding of network and application security, threat modeling, risk assessment techniques, and cybersecurity frameworks (e.g., OWASP, NIST).
* Knowledge of compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).


**Benefits**
**Who are we?**
 Expleo is a rapidly growing consulting company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions in the fields of AI engineering, digitalization, hyper-automation, cybersecurity, and data science. With a strong commitment to integrity, diversity, sustainability, and societal security, Expleo is at the forefront of creating a better future. Join our dynamic team and be part of our journey to shape the future of technology and business.
   

  

**What do we offer?**
* Collaborative working environment – we stand shoulder to shoulder with our clients and our peers through good times and challenges
* We empower all passionate technology loving professionals by allowing them to expand their skills and take part in inspiring projects
* Expleo Academy - enables you to acquire and develop the right skills by delivering a suite of accredited training courses
* Always working as one team, our people are not afraid to think big and challenge the status quo
* Collective agreement with the union
* Access to a collection of benefits and discounted prices on services and shops.
* Health benefits
* Expleo team activities


 "We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age ”.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
Your Team Responsibilities
   

  

 Team delivers functionality to a varaity of tools used by the real estate market around the world.
   

  

 Your Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Develop and support scalable, extensible and highly-available data pipelines on heterogeneous datasets that power downstream applications and systems and serve content to our web and API products
* Closely collaborate with partners across product and design, engineering, and business teams to drive innovations that improve our customers’ experience
* Follow software-development best practices including test-driven development, contributing to documentation, feature flagging, etc
* Help to maintain and improve existing ETL pipelines
* Work with your team to troubleshoot and fix issues in ingest and processing, taking into account the dependencies and integration points
* Collaborate with DevOps to plan resources and continuously optimize the infrastructure and configuration of our data pipelines to ensure a healthy and high-performance production deployments
* Performing any other tasks as assigned by line manager


**Your Skills And Experience That Will Help You Excel**
* Bachelors degree in Computer Science, or a related field
* Working knowledge and experience of Databricks and/or Snowflake
* Solid comprehension of common design patterns, algorithms, and data structures
* Solid understanding of distributed systems
* Working knowledge of containerization
* 2+ years of relevant back-end programming experience using languages such as Python, Node.js, Scala, or Java
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Experience with event-driven processing within a microservices oriented architecture
* Knowledge of Test Driven Development, Refactoring, Clean Code and Clean Architecture
* Experience working in an Agile software development organization


**About MSCI**
**What we offer you**
* Transparent compensation schemes and comprehensive employee benefits, tailored to your location, ensuring your financial security, health, and overall wellbeing.
* Flexible working arrangements, advanced technology, and collaborative workspaces.
* A culture of high performance and innovation where we experiment with new ideas and take responsibility for achieving results.
* A global network of talented colleagues, who inspire, support, and share their expertise to innovate and deliver for our clients.
* Global Orientation program to kickstart your journey, followed by access to our Learning@MSCI platform, LinkedIn Learning Pro and tailored learning opportunities for ongoing skills development.
* Multi-directional career paths that offer professional growth and development through new challenges, internal mobility and expanded roles.
* We actively nurture an environment that builds a sense of inclusion belonging and connection, including eight Employee Resource Groups. All Abilities, Asian Support Network, Black Leadership Network, Climate Action Network, Hola! MSCI, Pride & Allies, Women in Tech, and Women’s Leadership Forum.


 At MSCI we are passionate about what we do, and we are inspired by our purpose – to power better investment decisions. You’ll be part of an industry-leading network of creative, curious, and entrepreneurial pioneers. This is a space where you can challenge yourself, set new standards and perform beyond expectations for yourself, our clients, and our industry.
   

  

 MSCI is a leading provider of critical decision support tools and services for the global investment community. With over 50 years of expertise in research, data, and technology, we power better investment decisions by enabling clients to understand and analyze key drivers of risk and return and confidently build more effective portfolios. We create industry-leading research-enhanced solutions that clients use to gain insight into and improve transparency across the investment process.
   

  

 MSCI Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce. It is the policy of the firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, pregnancy (including unlawful discrimination on the basis of a legally protected parental leave), veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. MSCI is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. If you are an individual with a disability and would like to request a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application process, please email Disability.Assistance@msci.com and indicate the specifics of the assistance needed. Please note, this e-mail is intended only for individuals who are requesting a reasonable workplace accommodation; it is not intended for other inquiries.
   

  

**To all recruitment agencies**
 MSCI does not accept unsolicited CVs/Resumes. Please do not forward CVs/Resumes to any MSCI employee, location, or website. MSCI is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs/Resumes.
   

  

**Note on recruitment scams**
 We are aware of recruitment scams where fraudsters impersonating MSCI personnel may try and elicit personal information from job seekers. Read our full note on careers.msci.com

title: Data Engineer
description:
Blocket in Sweden, FINN.no in Norway, Bilbasen and DBA in Denmark, Oikotie and Tori in Finland collectively form Schibsted Marketplaces, serving over 325 million monthly visits. Our Sales Insights department is at the forefront of data-informed decisions and strategies to enhance our market presence and optimize sales performance.
   

  

**You?** 
 A passionate data enthusiast with a knack for driving decisions through data. You thrive in a dynamic environment where your technical and analytical skills have a direct commercial impact. You're excited by the prospect of shaping data architecture and leading technical initiatives.
   

  

**Role?** 
 As a Data Engineer within the Sales Insights team, you will take ownership of our data architecture, spearhead technical solutions, and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver actionable insights. Your primary responsibilities will include designing, developing, and maintaining robust ETL/ELT processes to transform raw data into meaningful business insights. You will leverage your expertise in the BI domain to drive innovation, optimise performance, and ensure the scalability of our data infrastructure.
   

  

**Why us?**
**Impact:** 
 Lead the charge in optimising our data architecture and delivering key insights that drive commercial decisions.
   

  

**Growth:** 
 Collaborate with various teams across the organisation, gaining broad experience and ample opportunities for professional growth.
   

  

**Innovation:** 
 Thrive in a forward-thinking environment that embraces emerging technologies and industry trends.
   

  

**Supportive Team:** 
 Join a team packed with engaged and friendly individuals who are passionate about what they do.
   

  

**Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!**
**WHO ARE YOU?**
* 4+ years of experience in the BI domain, with a focus on data engineering and data warehouse concepts.
* Proficiency in transforming data using ETL/ELT tools, and hands-on experience with the entire pipeline.
* Experience with platforms such as Databricks, DBT, Matillion and Snowflake.
* Proficiency in Python.
* Advanced SQL skills, including performance tuning and optimization.
* Familiarity with big data technologies such as Apache Spark and Kafka.
* Proficiency in data modelling techniques, including dimensional modelling and star schema design.
* Understanding of data governance, data quality management, and data security principles.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
* Experience in integrating data from various APIs and third-party sources.
* Experience working in an agile environment, with a forward-leaning and collaborative mindset.
* Knowledge of BI visualisation tools is a plus, but not required.


**WHAT’S THE JOB LIKE?**
* Lead the design, development, and optimization of ETL/ELT processes to support Sales’ data needs.
* Take ownership of the Sales Insights' data architecture, ensuring scalability, reliability, and performance.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.
* Mentor and guide team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth.
* Stay abreast of emerging technologies and industry trends, advocating for best practices and innovative solutions.
* Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels, presenting complex technical concepts clearly and concisely.


**What We Offer**
 We guarantee an engaging workplace where successes are celebrated, and colleagues support each other. Our benefits include various celebrations and plenty of opportunities to connect. Your well-being is a priority, supported by company benefits including physical and mental health support, flexible working hours, and on-site massage services. In our Oslo office, there's always cake to celebrate (which happens often), and in our Stockholm office, we cherish our Fika tradition.
   

  

**GOT YOUR ATTENTION? Let us hear from you!**
 If you're looking for a workplace where you can share your knowledge, learn and grow, get inspired, be yourself, and make a difference, let us hear from you! We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.
   

  

**QUESTIONS?**
**Head of Business Intelligence at Sales Insight, Micheal Zamayeri** 
 (micheal.zamayeri@schibsted.com), is happy to provide information about the daily work and answer any questions you may have about the role.

title: Global Enterprise Account Executive
description:
**This is Mevisio**
-------------------


Mevisio is a powerful platform designed to elevate operational performance for leaders and teams, driving efficiency through smart visualization and enhanced communication. Our application transforms traditional whiteboards into interactive touch screens, displaying real-time KPIs and activities tailored to each client's needs. Trusted by global companies and digital leaders, Mevisio is deployed in over 3,000 facilities across 60+ countries, with more than half of our revenue coming from international markets.


Our customizable platform integrates seamlessly with other systems, supporting clients in diverse industries, particularly manufacturing and healthcare, where Lean principles thrive. By reducing waste and boosting safety and sustainability, Mevisio empowers organizations to achieve operational excellence and improve their overall performance.

### **Why Mevisio?**


At Mevisio, you'll find a team with high ambitions and a people-first mindset. We thrive in an inclusive, collaborative environment where teamwork and drive go hand in hand. Stepping into our office, you'll meet passionate, kind individuals in a fast-growing SaaS company aiming to transform the manufacturing industry.
  

  

Guided by our core values—Customer First, People Matter, Better Together, and Aim High—we embrace courage, independence, and our different strengths to achieve our goals while having fun along the way.  

  

Check out our career page to get to know us more! ️https://careers.mevisio.com

### **What will you do?**


As a Global Enterprise Account Executive, your focus will lie in expanding sales on our international market. Your mission is to drive sales to new customers in the designated geographical market and manage the entire business process from prospecting to meetings, demonstration, negotiation and agreement and subsequent customer activities. You will run large parts of the business independently and when needed with support from more technical colleagues. Except from all of this, we hope you like the variety of other activities connected to sales, such as webinars, fairs, networks etc.


As a Global Enterprise Account Executive at Mevisio, you will have great possibilities to influence, not just yours but also as a company - our future way of working.


*Your tasks:*

* **Market Expansion:** Drive sales on the international market.
* **Prospecting:** Identify and engage potential clients.
* **Sales Cycle Management:** Handle meetings, demonstrations, negotiations, and closing deals.
* **Client Relationships:** Build and maintain client relationships for long-term success.
* **Collaboration:** Work with technical teams to customize solutions.
* **Event Participation**: Attend webinars, trade shows, and networking events to promote Mevisio.
* **Sales Strategy and Reporting:** Develop strategies and report on sales activities and forecasts.
* **Travels:** Be prepared for some travels around the globe, visiting big industries, or a mine, you never know!

### **What we think you will bring to us!**

* **5+ Years of Experience**: Proven track record in a similar role, preferably within the SaaS or manufacturing industry.
* **B2B Sales Expertise**: Strong background in business-to-business sales, with a focus on enterprise-level clients.
* **SaaS Industry Knowledge**: Familiarity with SaaS business models, subscription services, and cloud-based solutions.
* **Manufacturing Industry Understanding**: Experience or knowledge of the manufacturing sector, Lean methodologies, and operational efficiency.
* **Sales Cycle Management**: Demonstrated ability to manage the entire sales process, from prospecting to closing.
* **Market Expansion**: Experience in entering new markets, particularly in the USA, Germany/DACH, or the Nordics.
* **Technical Acumen**: Ability to understand and explain complex technical solutions, with support from technical teams.
* **CRM Proficiency**: Experience using CRM tools to track sales activities and pipeline progress.
* **Negotiation Skills**: Strong negotiation and closing skills with enterprise clients.
* **Event Representation**: Experience representing companies at trade shows, webinars, and industry events.
* **Collaboration**: Ability to work cross-functionally with internal teams, including product, marketing, and customer success.

#### **Who we're looking for**


Someone who's all up for the start-up environment! We are building a company together, with high ambitions and a lot of possibilities to make an impact. The market is huge and therefore we have a lot more to do in our journey. Since we are a start-up, nothing is consistent and we need all hands on deck to move forward, structure our processes, ways of working and share knowledge!


We need more experience and team-players out there and if you think you would like it here - we hope you want to reach out!

##### **Other perks and benefits**

Centrally located office near public transit  

️ 30 paid holidays annually  

Attractive wellness contribution  

Pension plan  

Opportunities for professional development  

Flexible working hours and hybrid office setup  

Access to a nearby gym  

Regular social gatherings and team activities  

Latest tech gear  

️ Breakfast every day, coffee and tea

 **Sounds exciting? Don't wait for the application!**

*NOTE! We kindly ask all external recruitment firms not to get in touch, due to an internal recruitment process.*

title: Technical Purchaser (Stockholm, Hybrid)
description:
**Do you want to shape the future of media and synchronization with us?**
-------------------------------------------------------------------------


Apply!


Are you ready to play a vital role in shaping and developing the procurement processes at Net Insight?

  

Do you have a knack for procuring electronical and maybe also mechanical components?


Are you friendly, collaborative and technically curious as a person?


Then you'll fit right in!


Our team today is small and focused on continuously improving the organization and its processes. This versatile role offers the opportunity to engage in a wide range of procurement activities, where you'll balance operational responsibilities with strategic and tactical initiatives.

 *Want to learn more about our products and get to know our people? Make sure to check us out on* ***LinkedIn*** *and* ***Youtube****!*


As our new Technical Purchaser, you will be a key part of the procurement team, combining your expertise in sourcing, purchasing and supplier management with a hands-on approach.


You will focus on sourcing related tasks for new product development projects.


In your category Purchaser role, you will manage purchasing volume products and components for specific product categories, ensuring availability in our finished goods warehouse. You will work closely with the Purchasing Manager, while reporting to the Head of Logistics & Procurement.  



  

**Key Responsibilities**

* Collaborate with project management, R&D and supply in product development projects.
* Source components and negotiate competitive prices to control total product costs.
* Evaluate quotes and bills of materials (BOMs), select suppliers, and negotiate contracts with project teams and stakeholders.
* Place and follow-up on orders and deliveries with suppliers to meet project timelines.
* Collaborate closely with contract manufacturing partners (EMS) to ensure all components and materials are sourced for prototype builds and production ramp up.
* Procure specific product categories and manage inventory levels to ensure availability in the finished goods warehouse based on customer demand.
* Develop procurement processes to support Net Insight’s growth and innovation goals.

**Good to knows:**

  

* We value work-life balance and have a hybrid work set-up (50/50)
* Full-time, permanent position
* Located in our HQ in Solna, Stockholm
* Our corporate language is English

**The products**


Our solutions are tailored to solve different media customer challenges and requirements.


We help broadcasters, service providers, production companies and enterprises to create live video workflows using the networks for their needs. We also enable faster and more secure 5G-rollouts for the world’s mobile networks.

  


**Your Profile**


You are a structured and goal-oriented individual with a passion for procurement and team wins.


As a skilled communicator, you thrive in cross-functional collaborations and embrace challenges with a problem-solving and pro-active attitude.


You are committed to continuous improvement, constantly seeking ways to enhance processes, drive efficiencies, and propose innovative solutions. With strong negotiation skills, you achieve cost reductions while maintaining professional supplier relationships.


A natural curiosity about technology drives your eagerness to learn about our products and components. Flexibility and adaptability are essential, as you thrive in dynamic environments and quickly adjust to changing circumstances.

**Skills and experience**


Bachelors degree in engineering, technical purchasing, logistics, or supply chain  

* 
5+ years of experience as a Purchaser, in a Procurement, Sourcing, or Purchasing organization, with a proven track record in tactical and operational processes with a focus on engineering and technical products  
* 
* Experience in purchasing electronic components, such as Integrated Circuits (ICs), FPGA, PCBA and you possess high commercial competence in the electronic components market

Solid hands-on experience of working with ERP systems (we use NetSuite)  

* 
* Proficiency in English, both written and spoken. Proficiency in Swedish is a bonus

 **Bonus skills**

  

* Experience in purchasing mechanical components and commercial competence in the mechanical components market
* Experience working with contract manufacturers (EMS)
* Experience working with Product Data Management (PDM) systems

**Our culture and beliefs:**


At Net Insight, **innovation**, **collaboration**, and **trust** are the cornerstones of our success. As one team, we are committed to delivering value to our customers, contributing to the growth and success of our company.


Together we create a dynamic and positive workplace where everyone is valued, engaged and empowered to make an impact

**Why choose us?**


At Net Insight, you’ll play a key role in shaping our Procurement function while working in an innovative and collaborative environment. With opportunities to influence processes, grow your expertise, and work closely with global partners and technical teams, you’ll enjoy a dynamic workplace that values your impact. We prioritize work-life balance, professional development, and fostering a strong, supportive culture.

**!**

  

Fill in the choice questions, upload you CV or LinkedIn profile + relevant documentation of you choice - That's it!


The position is permanent, full-time employment, based in our Headquarters in Solna Business Park.

  

We are recruiting continuously and we aim to get back to you as soon as possible.

*Note: We do not offer relocation support at this time.*

*Note 2: Background check will be part of our recruitment process.*

 **This is NET INSIGHT**

*Net Insight (Nasdaq: NETI B) provides the highest performing, most open video transport and media cloud technology for content providers as the industry standard for flexibility and service across live contribution, distribution and remote production media workflows.*

*For over 25 years, the world’s leading content owners, broadcasters, production companies, service providers and enterprises have trusted Net Insight’s Emmy® Award winning Nimbra technology to guarantee media delivery. Today, Net Insight partners with hundreds of customers in over 70 countries to ensure media flows across managed and unmanaged IP networks, and the cloud – from anywhere, to everywhere. It enables customers to get the best from any mix of virtualized, cloud and IP technology and is the only platform to support all the major industry standards, protocols and clouds.*

  

For more information, please visit *www.**netinsight.net*

title: Container Platform Engineer - Kubernetes/AKS Specialist
description:
We have the pedal to the metal in the expansion of our container platform offerings. Expanding our service in the cloud, specifically in Azure through AKS, while further developing our on-premise OpenShift. If you are an experienced Kubernetes/Container engineer and wish to contribute to our future Container Platform, let us know!
Swedbank is at the forefront of an exhilarating transformation, as the banking industry rapidly adapts to fast-paced innovation and evolving customer expectations. The Container Platform operates within the "Development Platforms" unit, where fostering excellent Developer Experience (DevEx) is paramount. Our solutions are utilized across the entire bank. We are driving the cultural shift necessary for modern software development practices and delivering exceptional services to our customers.
In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:Drive innovation and contribute to impactful projects that make a difference in society, leveraging your expertise in Kubernetes and containerization.
Be in a supportive and collaborative work environment where your ideas are valued, and your contributions makes a difference.
Shape the future of banking by providing the developers modern tools and way of working.

What is needed in this role:Hands-on experience with Kubernetes, ideally including Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS).
Strong customer-facing skills, with the ability to communicate effectively and build lasting relationships.
Proven track record in operating, troubleshooting, and optimizing performance in a Cloud Kubernetes services (AKS, AWS, GKE).
Experience with platform automation, including GitOps, CI/CD, infrastructure as code, and configuration management.
Understanding of multi-tenancy, security, and governance in cloud-native environments.
Agile mindset, adaptable to changing requirements and priorities.
Passion for innovation, staying aligned with container advancements and industry trends.

What we offer when you join us:An open, simple and caring culture
Opportunity to create the best experience for our customers
An international, sustainable and inclusive work environment
Development opportunities and advancement in your career
Flexible working options
Access to Group performance program, company pension plan, optional health insurance, and other **benefits**

"Join our team and...
work with Kubernetes enthusiasts in a fun and creative environment. We meet up on Thursdays at the office, and when we are not working together on-site, we work together over digital channels and maintain (according to us) a great culture of mob programming and collaboration. As a leader, I trust my team and delegate responsibility. Together we strive to create an open, positive and transparent environment, where everyone can grow and have the possibility to learn from each other." - Johan Edeljung, your future manager  

  

  

We look forward to receiving your application by 2024-02-23.
Location: Sundbyberg, Stockholm  

Recruiting manager: Johan Edeljung, +46 724517865  

We may begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome your application as soon as possible. *We have made our choice regarding recruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers or sellers of other recruitment services.*  

  

**Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.**

title: Senior C++ Engineer to Net Insight's Zyntai solution
description:
**OFFER**

  

Net Insight is a pioneering technology company that powers large-scale live broadcast events, connecting millions of viewers globally. Since 2021, they have established a rapidly expanding solution area focused on Synchronization. Leveraging their patented TV distribution synchronization technology, the Zyntai product portfolio is designed for nationwide 5G and power networks. *We are now looking for an experienced C++ developer to join them!*

**Some of the benefits of working at Net Insight:**

  

* A world leader in media networks and resource optimization with a strong focus on innovation
* Working with the latest tools in a very technologically advanced environment
* Open and flat organization and good work culture with a lot of teamwork
* Family-friendly company and a great understanding of pick-up/drop-off
* Flexible working hours. You mainly report to your team
* Unusually low turnover - High employee satisfaction!

 **THE PRODUCT AREA**

  

The purpose of the Zyntai solution is to provide 5G basestations with very accurate (nano-second level) time. A Zyntai timenet consists of hundreds or even thousands of TimeNodes, sending time to each other in a hierarchical multi-link setup. Every TimeNode is gathering information from its neighbouring nodes (several thousands measurements per second and neighbour). This information is used to understand the characteristics of the network, and to control the clock (oscillator) on the node using a control algorithm.


The core functionality is to distribute time over networks, GNSS independent, and with extremely high accuracy. The solution consists of new purpose-built hardware, advanced software-based automation algorithms, and a cloud-based management system. All are built with modern architecture and technologies.


The Synchronization solution is already making success for 5G worldwide and so far; Net Insight has established collaborations with large telecom operators in Europe and North America and over 20 nationwide TV networks.


For more info about the product, visit: https://netinsight.net/5g-sync

 **THE ROLE AND TEAMS**  

In this role, you will be working in the team responsible for the core synchronization functionality, with control algorithms and processing of data from time links, combined with an overall logic for handling different modes of operation.The majority of the coding is done in modern C++ (20, 23) and you will be working with control and signal processing related methods, such as Kalman filters, Model Predictive Control, Event handling, and Mathmematical Optimization.


The work involves algorithmic formulations, combined with software design and implementation in our product, mostly in C++ in TimeNodes, but also in other langugagues, such as Python, inside the Zyntai Director, which is a Kubernetes-based orchestration system for our TimeNodes.

  



Some short notes from the teams:

  

* We work with precise networked time synchronization. Think NTP, but four orders of magnitude better.
* We use C++ 20/23 and Python for various tasks like test execution and glue scripts.
* We take code review very seriously, not only to catch bugs but most importantly to share knowledge within the team. We sometimes do pair programming.
* Interacting with other teams and team members is crucial for success.

  


**YOUR PROFILE**  

Given smaller and self-autonomous teams there is a demand and wish that you thrive working in a more flexible/entrepreneurial way of working. This for example means a high degree of independence and initiative.


We think you are an experienced and social person who is used to working in close collaboration with other developers in agile teams; from system architecture, specification, and implementation of algorithms and functions to testing and verification. Even though you are a skilled engineer you still have a curiosity to learn and evolve but also share your expertise with others.


Seen to the technical elements, you need to have:

  

* Good knowledge of **modern C ++** with standard libraries
* Development of **Linux applications**
* Solid knowledge and experience from **TCP/IP** and **Network Communication**
* Good knowledge of Linux and systems with real-time requirement
* **Agile working methods** such as scrum, TDD, and continuous integration
* 

It is an advantage if you have experience in some of the following:

* MPC, Model predictive control
* Kalman filter
* PI/PID Controller
* Experience in cloud applications and cybernetics
* Graph theory
* Signal processing
* Statistics
* Optimization (in the mathematical sense)
* Automatic control
* Basic cryptography (TLS certs, AES)

 **ABOUT NET INSIGHT**  

Net Insight is a global leader in media networks, resource optimization, and streaming solutions. With more than 25 years of experience, Net Insight is a trusted and important partner and a leading force in the media tech industry in creating a better media experience. More than 500 world-class customers run mission-critical media services using Net Insight’s solutions in more than 70 countries worldwide.


Net Insight is powering the evolving media business in a connected world where technology enables seamless meetings between producers, distributors, and consumers of content – regardless of geographical location, technical resources, or distribution network. With its deep market knowledge and insight, genuine customer focus, and world-leading innovative technology, Net Insight makes it easier to create and deliver better content more reliably and effectively. Net Insight is listed on Nasdaq Stockholm.


For more info, visit https://netinsight.net/

**ABOUT PINETREE**

  

At Pinetree, we have a vision and mission to differentiate ourselves from the crowd and are Sweden's contenders in talent search and matching.


By working as an agency, the value to you as an employee is that we have a wide network of partner companies that we continuously ensure high-quality standards.

**This recruitment is direct employment at Net Insight AB and all applications, questions, administration, and recruitment processes are managed by Pinetree AB.**

title: Nanny + Content creator
description:
**Om oss**

Vi är en mindre webbyrå som främst arbetar med webbdesign, utveckling och digital marknadsföring. För att förenkla och effektivisera vår vardag söker vi nu en person som trivs i en bred roll: 50% av tiden i hushållet med barnpassning och sysslor i hemmet, samt 50% på byrån med exempelvis content creation, administration, utveckling och marknadsföring.

**Arbetsuppgifter**

1. **Hushåll (50%)**

* Ta hand om barn (barnpassning, lek och enklare aktiviteter)
* Hjälpa till med tvätt och enklare städning
* Fixa vardagssysslor såsom att handla och laga lättare måltider
* Organisera och underhålla hemmet (plocka undan, hålla ordning, etc.)

2. **Content creator webbyrå (50%)**

Exempel på uppgifter, men vi anpassar det efter dina intressen:

* Skapa och uppdatera innehåll (text, bild, eventuell videoproduktion) på olika plattformar
* Hantera enklare administration, t.ex. fakturering, offertunderlag, kundkontakt
* Assistera i marknadsföring och säljprojekt, exempelvis utskick, kampanjer och sociala medier
* Hjälpa till i utvecklingsprojekt (t.ex. upplägg av innehåll i WordPress eller andra system)
* Bidra till interna processer, som att strukturera arbetsuppgifter, följa upp projekt m.m.

**Kvalifikationer - hushåll**

* Erfarenhet av barnpassning

**Kvalifikationer - content creator**

Du behöver ingen utbildning eller erfarenhet, men intresse för att lära dig. Kanske har du jobbat med något helt annat tidigare och vill skola om. Eller kanske är du ny på arbetsmarknaden.

* Intresse för content creation, administration, marknadsföring, försäljning eller enklare webbutveckling
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och gärna engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Grundläggande datorkunskaper (kunna arbeta i Office-paketet, Google Workspace eller liknande)
* Meriterande om du har erfarenhet av CMS (t.ex. WordPress) eller grafiska program (t.ex. Canva eller Adobe Creative Cloud)

**Övrigt**:

* Du är snäll och gillar att leka med barn.
* Du är strukturerad, självgående och tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter
* Du är social, kommunikativ och samarbetar bra i både familj- och byråmiljö
* Körkort B är ett plus (men inget krav)
* Du värdesätter ordning, är positiv och lösningsorienterad

**Omfattning och arbetstider**

* 50% hushåll/barnpassning + 50% arbete på webbyrån = 100% tjänst totalt
* Arbetstider kan variera och viss flexibilitet krävs (t.ex. kväll eller helg för barnpassning vid behov)
* Exakta arbetstider och schema diskuteras tillsammans

**Vi erbjuder**

* En unik möjlighet att kombinera praktiskt hushållsarbete med kreativt och administrativt arbete på en webbyrå
* Variationsrika arbetsdagar och stor möjlighet att påverka din egen planering
* Ett familjärt och positivt arbetsklimat i både hemmiljö och byråmiljö
* Möjlighet till utveckling och att lära sig nya färdigheter inom digital marknadsföring, försäljning och webbutveckling

**Ansökan**

Ansök via InDeed med personligt brev. Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt.

Jobbtyp: Heltid

Lön: 25 000,00kr - 30 000,00kr per månad

Förmåner:

* Extra semesterdagar
* Friskvårdsbidrag

Språk:

* Svenska (Obligatoriskt)

Arbetsort: Personligen

Förväntat startdatum: 2025-02-03

title: Preclinical Bioinformatics Lead
description:
**Date:** 23 Jan 2025
**Department:** Portfolio Management
**Team:** R&D, Pharmacovigilance & Regulatory Affairs
**Job Type:** Direct Employee
**Contract Type:** Permanent
**Location:**Europe - remote, SE
***About us***
Based in Parma, Italy, Chiesi is an international research-focused pharmaceutical and healthcare group with over 85 years’ experience, operating in 31 countries with more than 7,000 employees (Chiesi Group). To achieve its mission of improving people’s quality of life by acting responsibly towards society and the environment, the Group researches, develops and markets innovative drugs in its main therapeutic areas: **Discover more here**
We are proud to be the largest global pharmaceutical group to be awarded **B Corp Certification**, a recognition of **high social and environmental standards**. We are a **reliable** company that adopts and promotes a **transparent and ethical behavior** at all levels.
We believe that the success of **Chiesi is built and shaped by our people and our strong set of shared Values and Behaviors**. Our people make a critical difference to our success, which is why it is vital that we attract and retain the right talent who will continue to enrich our culture by living and breathing our values and behaviors.
In fact, we are a global family made up of different cultures, different genders, generations, ethnicities, abilities, sexual identities and many other enriching diversities.  


***Chiesi Research & Development***
Our R&D team represents a fundamental asset for the business. It is divided into integrated functional areas focusing on pipeline projects including discovery and preclinical research, global technical development, drug delivery technology, clinical development, regulatory affairs, pharmacovigilance, intellectual property, quality assurance, R&D project and portfolio management. Headquartered in the new purpose-built and fully integrated Research and Development Centre in Parma (Italy), the team also has important operations in Paris (France), Chippenham (UK), Cary (US), Stockholm (Sweden), Toronto (Canada) and Shanghai (China).  


***Who we are looking for***
**Purpose**

As a Bioinformatics Lead you will be a part of the to be part of the PPM & R&D Digital Strategy and Execution Support Unit within R&D Project & Portfolio Management organization at the company.  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Provide bioinformatic expertise to address a wide variety of biological questions by analyzing and interpreting data, generating reports and building systematic internal data repositories.
* Conduct omics analyses towards target identification and drug mode of action characterization with emphasis on transcriptomic (scRNA-seq), genomic (WGS, WES), and proteomic (MS, Olink) data, to be connected with patient strata and clinical data.
* Design, build and monitor analysis pipelines of molecular data and omic data (e.g. Nextflow / Snakemake) using cloud computing solutions (AWS, Azure) and code repositories (e.g. Gitlab).
* Perform initial quality control checks (pre-processing and cleaning) and downstream analysis on data coming from -omics studies.
* Perform multi-omic data integration approaches, network analysis, and pathway-level statistical analysis to generate new hypotheses and collaborate with scientists on data mining and guiding experimental design.
* Collect, QC and homogenize public data sets towards their analysis and integration with internally-generated data, provide input to systematic multi-omic data repository creation and management towards drug repositioning.
* Coordinate and oversee data analysis with external service providers.


**Experience Required**
* PhD in bioinformatics and/or computational biology, with a strong biological/medical background, and minimum of 5 years’ post-graduate experience.
* Proficiency in analyzing NGS and single-cell analysis and subcellular analysis and other ‘omics’ data using statistical programming languages (e.g., R/Bioconductor, Python, etc.).
* Demonstrated track record of applying bioinformatic analysis, including machine learning techniques and network biology, to integrate and analyze omic and clinical data, preferably within respiratory drug development.
* Broad understanding of drug discovery and development, particularly early and late-stage development.
* Strong publication record as a leading author.


**Languages**

English fluent
***What we offer***
You would join a dynamic, fast-growing, challenging and friendly environment.  

In Chiesi we firmly believe that **our people are our most valuable asset**, that is why we invest in continuous training, learning and development. Therefore, we strive to continuously promote and satisfy development needs, paying particular **attention to the quality of our working environment and to collective well-being.**  

**We want our people to come to work happy every day**, and we know how important it is to find the right **work-life balance** in order to be able to give our best. That is why we offer flexible working approach, remote working, support in the relocation process, tax assistance service for foreign colleagues and many other people-care services.

title: Product Support Manager (on-site)
description:
**About Kisi**
==============


We are Kisi, a physical security tech company revolutionizing how businesses access and secure their spaces.

  

Founded in 2012, with headquarters in Brooklyn, an office in Stockholm, and a global team, we create innovative, award-winning hardware and compliance-certified software that enable seamless, cloud-based access to offices, facilities, and buildings. Our mission is to ensure ease of access and remote space management, fostering a future where spaces are securely connected and accessible without boundaries.

  

At Kisi, you’ll join a creative and innovative team with a flat hierarchy, work closely with our co-founders, and enjoy the freedom to work your way with a strong sense of ownership.

  

If you’re passionate about cutting-edge technology and want to be part of a dynamic team that’s making the world more secure and accessible, we want to hear from you!

**About the role**
==================


We are seeking a Product Support Team Manager to lead our growing customer support operations. In this role, you will be responsible for implementing and executing our support strategy, managing our support portal, maintaining technical product documentation, and overseeing a dedicated team of support specialists.  

  

We’re looking for a candidate with at least three years of technical support experience, strong leadership skills, an ability to quickly master new products, and a pragmatic approach to problem-solving. If you’re passionate about delivering exceptional customer support and driving process improvements, we’d love to hear from you!

**What you'll do**
==================

* Strategic planning and execution of support operations: develop and implement our support strategy across different customer segments, ensuring alignment with service-level objectives and broader organizational goals.
* Excellence in execution: continuously elevate support quality by benchmarking against industry best practices in terms of cost, budget, and response times, then exceeding these standards.
* Help customers help themselves: create, update, and optimize support content and troubleshooting guides so customers can independently resolve common questions and issues.
* Manage a growing support team: lead and supervise an expanding team of support specialists, ensuring adherence to best practices and competitive performance benchmarks.
* Keep customers, partners, and colleagues informed: maintain up-to-date product guides and documentation, providing clear self-service resources. Gather feedback from customers to refine our offerings, and keep teams across the organization informed of changes or updates.

**Qualifications**
==================

* 3+ years of experience managing support operations.
* Experience with driving a team based on clearly defined and attainable objectives and key results. We put emphasis on execution for this role.
* Relevant and solid technical support experience, preferably in a B2B or SaaS environment, with a proven track record of leading team members.
* Well-rounded leadership, coaching, and team management skills, including the ability to learn new products quickly and explain complex technical concepts clearly.
* Good communication and cross-functional collaboration skills, supported by a history of implementing process improvements to streamline workflows.
* Familiarity with ticketing systems (e.g., Zendesk, HubSpot) and maintaining technical documentation or knowledge bases.
* Basic understanding of circuitry (plus/minus, AC/DC); we’re not looking for engineers, but an openness to learn is encouraged.
* **Please note that this is an on-site role, requiring full-time attendance five days a week at our Stockholm office, located on Södermalm.**

**Your process with us**
========================


Application > CV screening > Intro call (let’s get to know each other!) > Recruitment task > Hiring Manager Interview > On-site Interview > Offer.

  

After successful interviews and the job offer is signed, we will conduct a background check.
company_description: We are Kisi, a physical security technology company that accelerates a world where the right people can share physical resources at any time. Founded in 2012, Kisi operates from a headquarter in Brook

title: Data Scientist
description:
We’re seeking a Data Scientist with AI-experience. If you thrive on leveraging the power of data and technology to enhance strategic growth, this role is for you! Apply and join us on this exciting journey and play a crucial role in shaping the future of our data and insights area.  



My name is Åsa Boffardi , Head of Analytics, Martech & AI within Telia SE B2B. Our mission is to leverage cutting-edge digital technologies and advanced analytics to empower informed decision-making and world class user experiences. We strive to drive innovation and deliver actionable insights, ensuring our organization remains at the forefront of the analytics, Martech and AI, committed to excellence and data-driven success .  



**Is this** **yo** **ur next opportunity?**

As a Data Scientist at Telia, you will be responsible for using various statistical techniques and tools to analyze data and identify patterns that can provide insights to drive decision-making. This includes predictive analysis and model building. You will make complex data understandable for stakeholders through visualizations or other means.  



**The work duties consist of but are not limited to:**

* Gather and clean data from various sources, including databases, APIs, and websites, ensuring its accuracy and reliability.
* Use statistical techniques and tools to analyze data and identify patterns that can provide insights to drive decision-making.
* Develop models and evaluate the accuracy, performance, and robustness of machine learning models, ensuring they are reliable and effective in generating insights and predictions.
* Work closely with engineers to ensure that machine learning models get into production environments, integrating them into business processes or applications to generate real-time insights and predictions.
* Handle tools and processes for monitoring model performance and improving them
* Collaborate within an analytical team that works closely with B2B business stakeholders.
* Engage in the entire analytical process, from identifying business opportunities to developing and deploying models, and making data-driven decisions
**Is** **t** **his You?**

We think that you have a passion for data science and a strong background in statistical techniques and machine learning. You thrive in a collaborative environment and have experience working with various stakeholders to drive business decisions. You bring a strong analytical mindset and have previously worked on developing and deploying machine learning models.


**Your experience:**

* Experience in working as Data Scientist or similar analytics role
* Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Finance or equivalent
* Strong analytical skills and the ability to comprehend , analyze and put numbers into insights
* Strong communication skills with ability to customize messages to reach different competences
* Abilit y to work with large amounts of complex data from multiple data sources.
* Skills in SQL and Python are needed , s kills in SAS and Qlik and Python is a plus
* Experience working on cloud-based platforms
**Telia is More Than a Workplace**

With us, you will learn from skilled colleagues across international borders, joining a team that makes each other stronger and the world better by solving challenges. We are proud of our friendly atmosphere where people are excited about their work. We thrive on our diversity and ambition to deliver great products and extraordinary experiences for our customers. In a world where choices are endless, if you want to make a real impact, this is a place where you belong.


**Apply to join us!**

If you fancy joining our team, don’t hesitate to apply!


If you want to know more about the job you are welcome to contact Talent Partner Christine Wilén at christine.wilen@teliacompany.com . Location for this position is: Solna, Stockholm.


We look forward to receiving your application and to making sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. During the process, required background controls will be performed.


**Welcome to Telia – Join us and make better happen!**

title: Receptionist Scandic Malmö City
description:
Scandic Malmö City ligger som namnet antyder mycket centralt- vid kanalen med närhet till Gustav Adolfs Torg såväl som Malmös shoppingstråk. Hotellets restaurang är en naturlig mötesplats för våra inresta gäster. Med gäster från världens alla hörn skapar vi dagligen goda relationer med våra gäster. Vår gästnöjdhet är vår prioritet och vi har en mycket stark servicekultur hos oss-en servicekultur som möjliggörs av att vi också har nöjda medarbetare som är stolta över sin arbetsplats och ser möjligheterna att fortsätta utvecklas.


**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Malmö City.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en visstidsanställning på deltid.


Vi söker just nu en engagerad och ansvarstagande kollega som vill vara en del av vårt team från april till oktober 2025. Tjänsten innebär arbete varannan helg, med möjlighet att utöka kontraktet under sommaren beroende på verksamhetens behov.


Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------


Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.

title: Nordics Enterprise Partner Manager
description:
Veeam®, the #1 global market leader in data protection and ransomware recovery, is on a mission to empower every organization to not just bounce back from a data outage or loss but bounce forward.



With Veeam, organizations achieve radical resilience through data security, data recovery, and data freedom for their hybrid cloud.



The Veeam Data Platform delivers a single solution for cloud, virtual, physical, SaaS, and Kubernetes environments that gives IT and security leaders peace of mind that their apps  

and data are protected and always available.



Headquartered in Seattle with offices in more than 30 countries, Veeam protects over 450,000 customers worldwide, including 74% of the Global 2000, who trust Veeam to keep their businesses running.

  

As the **Nordics Enterprise Partner Manager** you will be responsible for selling our products and solutions through ATEA in Denmark, Finland, Norway & Sweden. The primary goal is to increase sales and pro-activity. The Partner Manager will help drive and support the Nordics Partner's sales and marketing activities in line with growth targets, utilising best practice across their subsidiaries/affiliates.



The Nordics Partner Manager must interact with team members who manage these partners at a local level (including sales, product, marketing, services and legal) to support local activities and achieve revenue expectations.



You will also build close relationships with sales, engineering, marketing and management in the Nordics and work with them to develop new sales opportunities.



Knowledge of the software industry and previous experience in Enterprise Partner management is mandatory, as are very good English skills, excellent interpersonal skills, great attention to detail, a can-do attitude and a high degree of pragmatism.



You should also have a strong willingness to travel and a valid driving license.


#### **Your tasks will include:**


* Develop best practices and work with local teams to implement them,
* Foster win-win relationships that meet both profitability and growth targets
* You will work closely with the partner to create and implement go-to-market plans that consistently cover product and market promotion aspects to achieve agreed sales targets
* Work closely with local sales and technical teams to continuously understand and fulfil the partner's requirements.
* Achieve the set sales targets
* Work closely as a team with Veeam Account Managers, Consultants and Marketing to win projects in both the mid-market and enterprise customer segments.
* Ensure this partner is trained and certified to Veeam standards, identify areas of improvement and seek input from other teams.
* You must be able to present all Veeam solutions and show partners the added value.

#### **What we expect from you:**


* Your strength and experience is in partner sales and you have a proven track record in software companies
* Experience in working with Nordic partners, preferably ATEA, in multicultural environments and teams
* Ability to multitask, quickly change priorities and work under pressure
* Strong process skills and attention to detail
* Excellent communication skills, with experience at management level
* Ability to realize & execute on global plan
* Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills
* You have a solution-orientated approach and can inspire your partners for add-on products and solutions and also attract and motivate new partners.
* Knowledge of virtualisation, backup, cloud, disaster recovery is an advantage
* A high willingness to travel is a matter of course for you, as well as an IT affinity and the willingness to go the extra mile.


Please note: If the applicant is permanently located outside of Sweden, Veeam reserves the right to decline the application for the position. Remote work is only possible for employees located in Sweden.  

#LI-JK1



Veeam Software is an equal opportunity employer and does not tolerate discrimination in any form on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law. All your information will be kept confidential.

Please note that any personal data collected from you during the recruitment process will be processed in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Notice.



The Privacy Notice sets out the basis on which the personal data collected from you, or that you provide to us, will be processed by us in connection with our recruitment processes.



By applying for this position, you consent to the processing of your personal data in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Notice.

title: Art Director med redaktörsinslag
description:
**Art Director med redaktörsinslag till Livsstil 24 – Forma och fyll temabilagor med innehåll som engagerar!**

Är du en kreativ Art Director med ett öga för design och en känsla för text? Livsstil 24 söker en mångsidig talang som vill ta huvudrollen som Art Director men också bidra som redaktör i mindre omfattning. Hos oss får du chansen att skapa temabilagor som distribueras med Aftonbladet – innehåll som når ut till en bred och inspirerande publik.

Livsstil 24 kombinerar kvällstidningarnas breda räckvidd med magasinens förmåga att skapa nischat och engagerande innehåll. Med vår långa erfarenhet och passion för design och innehåll skapar vi tryckta bilagor och digital annonsering som verkligen fångar intresset hos läsarna.

**Om rollen**

I din primära roll som Art Director ansvarar du för att formge och skapa layout för våra temabilagor. Du får ta fram kreativa lösningar för olika teman och arbeta med hela processen från idé till färdigt material för tryck och digital publicering.

Som en del av din tjänst kommer du även att bidra som redaktör genom att skapa eller redigera enklare texter, se till att innehållet harmonierar med designen och säkerställa att kommunikationen är tydlig och engagerande.

**Vi söker dig som:**

* Har gedigen erfarenhet som Art Director och en portfölj som visar din designkompetens.
* Behärskar **Adobe Creative Cloud**, särskilt InDesign, Photoshop och Illustrator.
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med trycksaker och förståelse för tryckprocessens krav.
* Är nyfiken på att lära dig nya saker och inte rädd för att ta dig an utmaningar.
* Har ett kreativt öga för layout och en känsla för detaljer.
* Är en duktig skribent eller redaktör som kan skapa och anpassa texter efter målgrupp och sammanhang.
* Trivs i en dynamisk miljö där du hanterar flera projekt samtidigt och levererar inom deadlines.

**Vad vi erbjuder**

* En roll med varierande arbetsuppgifter som kombinerar design och redaktionellt arbete.
* Möjligheten att arbeta med välkända format och nå ut till en bred publik.
* Ett kreativt och engagerat team med lång erfarenhet i branschen.
* Chansen att utvecklas och sätta din egen prägel på våra temabilagor.
* En arbetsplats där nya idéer och initiativ alltid välkomnas.

**Ansökan**

Vi ser fram emot att få din ansökan! Sista ansökningsdag är **15 februari**, men intervjuer sker löpande, så vänta inte för länge med att söka.

Välkommen till Livsstil 24 – där vi skapar innehåll som inspirerar och engagerar!

**Ansök nu och visa hur du kan kombinera design och text på bästa sätt!**
